The '''International reaction to ''[[Fitna (film)|Fitna]]''''' consisted of condemnation from [[Muslims]], several [[fatwa]] against [[Geert Wilders]], and attempts by many [[Islamism|Islamic]] countries to [[Censorship|censor]] the film. The [[Netherlands|Dutch]] government immediately distanced itself from the film. Several Muslim organizations and political parties organized [[boycott]]s against [[Netherlands|Dutch]] products.
==Prior to the release== It was feared that the film would lead to violent demonstrations by Muslims much like the organized protests against the [[Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons controversy|Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons]] that were published in the [[Denmark|Danish]] newspaper ''[[Jyllands-Posten]]'' in 2005.<ref name="embassyburning">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/4681294.stm|title=Embassies burn in cartoon protest|date=2006-02-04|accessdate=2008-03-08|publisher=[[BBC]]}}</ref> The Dutch counter-terrorism agency raised its terror risk level from "limited" to "substantial", noting Islamist death threats against Wilders and calls to attack Dutch troops.<ref name="dtl">{{cite news|title=Dutch raise threat level ahead of anti-Koran film|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idINIndia-32339620080306|date=2008-03-06|accessdate=2008-04-02|first=Emma|last=Thomasson|work=[[Reuters]]}}</ref> Previous violence included the burning of the Danish embassy in [[Syria]] and other acts of violence around the world, including the murder of a [[Roman Catholic Church|Catholic]] nun.<ref>{{cite news | title =In defence of the right to offend | url = http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/cdc31436-cbb1-11dc-97ff-000077b07658.html |date = 2008-01-26 | accessdate =2008-01-27 |author=Caldwell, Christopher| work= |publisher=[[Financial Times]]}}</ref>
===In the Netherlands=== The movie was first mentioned in the Dutch media on November 27, 2007. The Dutch government almost immediately expressed great concern about the film release.<ref name="First mention of the movie">{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/2634487/Provocerende_film_Wilders.html?p=26,1|language=Dutch|title=Provocerende film Wilders|work=[[De Telegraaf]]|first=Paul|last=Jansen|date=2007-11-27|accessdate=2008-03-22}}</ref> It made evacuation plans available to all its consulates and embassies worldwide and tightened security measures around military installations abroad.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/currentaffairs/080123-wilders-film-dutch-mct |title=Wilders and his film worry Dutch expats |work=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]] |date=23 January 2008 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>
The Prime minister of the Netherlands, [[Jan Peter Balkenende]], worried about possible repercussions for Dutch citizens and economic interests.<ref name="balkenende">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/mar/03/netherlands.islam|title=Dutch government could ban anti-Islam film|first=Mark|last=Tran|date=2008-03-03|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=[[The Guardian]] | location=London}}</ref> In response Wilders accused Balkenende of capitulating to Islam.<ref name="balkenende2">{{cite web|url=http://www.elsevier.nl/nieuws/laatste_24_uur/artikel/asp/artnr/194215/|language=Dutch|title=Wilders: Premier is beroepslafaard|date=2008-02-23|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=elsevier.nl|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080308184002/http://www.elsevier.nl/nieuws/laatste_24_uur/artikel/asp/artnr/194215/|archivedate=2008-03-08|df=}}</ref>
Wilders had been warned by Dutch National Counterterrorism Co-ordinator [[:nl:Tjibbe Joustra (ambtenaar)|Tjibbe Joustra]] that his film may "lead to reactions that endanger public order, security and the economy".<ref name="warn_wilders">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7204452.stm|title=Dutch MP warned over Islam film|accessdate=2008-03-31|publisher=BBC News|date=2008-01-23}}</ref> The publication of the film was investigated by the [[Ministry of Justice and Security|Dutch Ministry of Justice]] to find out whether the release of the film could be prevented, but this could not be done.{{citation needed|date=April 2013}} In an opinion poll, 54% of Dutch people still believed that the film should be released, despite any possible negative effects.<ref name="poll">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSL0522616520080305|title=Dutch want Koran film shown but fear reactions: poll|accessdate=2008-03-31|publisher=Reuters|date=2008-03-05 | first=Emma | last=Thomasson}}</ref>
On March 6, 2008, the Dutch government raised its national risk level of a [[Tactics of terrorism|terrorist attack]] from the status 'limited' to 'substantial' because of concerns that Muslim terrorists would launch attacks against European targets, using the film as justification.<ref name="terror">{{cite web|url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/196174/2008/03/06/Nederland-vreest-aanslagen-wegens-film-Wilders.dhtml|title=Nederland vreest aanslagen wegens film Wilders|language=Dutch|date=2008-03-06|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=hln.be}}</ref><ref name="terror2">{{cite news|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,2144,3175532,00.html|title=Dutch Raise Terror Threat Level After Film Stokes Muslim Hostility|date=2008-03-07|accessdate=2008-03-09|work=dw-world.de}}</ref>
A demonstration against the release of the film occurred in [[Dam Square]], in [[Amsterdam]], on 22 March 2008.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7309838.stm|title= Dutch protest against Islam film |date= 2008-03-22|work=[[BBC]]|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref> In response to concerns, Dutch broadcaster ''[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]]'' created a multi-language website to detail the film, the surrounding controversy, its creator, and the nation of its origin.<ref name="Radio Netherlands site">{{cite web|url=http://www.rnw.nl/aboutfitna/|title= About Fitna The Movie|accessdate=2008-03-24|publisher=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]]}}</ref> The Dutch newspaper ''[[De Pers]]'' printed a reconstruction of how the concerns came about and who was responsible for them.<ref name="De Pers Article reconstructie van fitna-gate">{{cite web|url=http://www.depers.nl/binnenland/178021/Reconstructie-van-Fitna-gate.html|title=Reconstructie van Fitna-gate|accessdate=2008-03-27|date=2008-03-03|work=Dutch|publisher=[[De Pers]]}}</ref>
A large advertisement was placed on the front page of ''[[de Volkskrant]]'' stating that if Wilders had said the things he has said about Muslims, about Jews, he would have been prosecuted for [[antisemitism]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nrc.nl/binnenland/article976448.ece/Advertentie_tegen_Wilders_op_voorpagina_Volkskrant|title=Advertentie tegen Wilders op voorpagina Volkskrant|language=Dutch|work=[[NRC Handelsblad]]|date=2008-03-17|accessdate=2008-03-28}}</ref> The advertisement was endorsed by the Jewish organisations ''[[Stichting de Initiavieven]]'' and ''[[Een Ander Joods Geluid]]''.
===Other reactions=== On 7 April 2008, [[Indonesia]] blocked access to [[YouTube]] and a number of other websites, such as MySpace and Multiply. Minister of Menkon Info Muhammad Nuh passed a bill that forced 146 ISP's in Indonesia to block access to YouTube on Monday. [[Kompas]] confirmed that the reason for the block was YouTube's refusal to remove ''Fitna'' from their servers.<ref name="Indonesia Blocks YouTube">{{Cite web|url=http://www.kompas.co.id/tekno/read.php?cnt=.xml.2008.04.07.10341640&channel=7&mn=114&idx=114|title=Indonesia Blokir YouTube|accessdate=2008-04-07|publisher=[[Kompas]], Indonesia|date=2008-04-07|language=Indonesian}}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The block has now been removed, and the foreign relation minister has apologised to the people for any inconvenience.
The [[European Union|EU]] alerted its [[diplomatic mission]]s around the world to expect a reaction to the release of the film.<ref name="eu1">{{cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/961220.html|title=EU braces for outrage over Dutch lawmaker's anti-Koran film|date=2008-03-05|accessdate=2008-03-25|work=[[The Associated Press]]}}</ref>
[[NATO]] said it feared that the consequences of ''Fitna'' would affect the safety of troops in [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|Afghanistan]].<ref name="natofears">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7274259.stm|title=Nato fears over Dutch Islam film|date=2008-03-03|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=[[BBC]]}}</ref> Indeed, [[Zabihullah Mujahid]] stressed that the [[Taliban]] would increase their attacks on Dutch military and humanitarian peacekeepers in Afghanistan, if the film were released.<ref name="talibanthreat">{{cite web|url=http://kleinverzet.blogspot.com/2008/02/taliban-threatens-attacks-because-of.html|title=Taliban threatens attacks because of Wilders film|date=2008-02-28|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=[[Algemeen Nederlands Persbureau]]|publisher=Expatica News}}</ref>
President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] declared that [[France]] would provide the support to the Netherlands in the event of international problems.<ref name="francehelp">{{cite web|url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/960/Buitenland/article/detail/195560/2008/03/05/Frankrijk-belooft-Nederland-steun-na-Wilders-film.dhtml|title=Frankrijk belooft Nederland steun na Wilders-film|language=Dutch|date=2008-03-05|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=hln.be}}</ref>
[[Iran]] threatened to review its diplomatic stance with the Netherlands if the film was aired.<ref name="foxiranwarn">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,324406,00.html|title=Iran Warns Netherlands Not to Air Controversial 'Anti-Muslim' Film|work=[[Fox News]]|first=Michael|last=Park|date=2008-01-21|accessdate=2008-03-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090612070628/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,324406,00.html|archive-date=2009-06-12|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> Public protests occurred in [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]].<ref name="kabul1">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSISL1279420080322?pageNumber=1&virtualBrandChannel=0|title=Afghans chant death in cartoon protest|date=2008-03-22|accessdate=2008-03-24|work=[[Reuters]]|first=Ahmad|last=Masood}}</ref><ref name="kabul2">{{cite news|url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=48495&sectionid=351020403|title=Afghans protest Danish cartoons|date=2008-03-22|accessdate=2008-03-24|work=[[Press TV]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080416124218/http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=48495&sectionid=351020403|archivedate=2008-04-16|df=}}</ref> [[Egypt]] said it was closely monitoring the situation.<ref name="egypt">{{cite web|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gPfRaEYgm1Qxcws2W1wbCuTK9GGw |title=Egypt 'monitoring attacks on Islam ahead of Dutch TV film' |date=2008-02-22 |accessdate=2008-03-08 |work=[[Agence France-Presse]] |publisher=[[Google]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080309100648/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gPfRaEYgm1Qxcws2W1wbCuTK9GGw |archivedate=March 9, 2008 }}</ref>
In February 2008, [[Pakistan]] internally banned [[YouTube]] for several days due to a video clip one report claimed to be a trailer for ''Fitna'';<ref name="pakistanblock">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7261727.stm|title=Pakistan blocks YouTube website|date=2008-02-24|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=[[BBC]]}}</ref> the ban was lifted a few days later.<ref name="pakistanlift">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/7262071.stm|title=Pakistan lifts the ban on YouTube|date=2008-02-26|accessdate=2008-03-08|work=[[BBC]]}}</ref> As a result of the block, [[Pakistan]] accidentally caused YouTube to be unavailable worldwide for two hours.<ref name="worldwideoutage">{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/02/25/pakistan.youtube/index.html |title=Pakistan move knocked out YouTube |work=[[CNN]] |date=2008-02-05 |accessdate=2008-03-08 |author=[[Associated Press]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080229001908/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/02/25/pakistan.youtube/index.html |archivedate=2008-02-29 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/infotech/view/20080226-121307/Pakistans-YouTube-ban-briefly-affected-global-access|title=Pakistan's YouTube ban briefly affected global access|work=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=Inquirer.net|date=2008-02-26|accessdate=2008-03-27}}</ref><ref name="youtube-hijack">{{cite web|url=http://www.ripe.net/news/study-youtube-hijacking.html |title=YouTube Hijacking: A RIPE NCC RIS case study |work=[[RIPE]] |date=2008-02-28 |accessdate=2008-03-31 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080405030750/http://www.ripe.net/news/study-youtube-hijacking.html |archivedate=2008-04-05 |df= }}</ref>
The [[Grand Mufti]], Ahmad Badr al-Din, said that if Geert Wilders showed the image of a burning Qur'an in his film, the Dutch people will be held responsible and possible attacks against [[Western world|Western]] public interests would not be not out of the question.<ref name="timeline">{{cite web|url=http://www.fitnathemovie.info/timeline.php|title=Geert Wilders Fitna Movie Timeline|publisher=FeceOnAir.com|accessdate=2008-03-08|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080306185627/http://www.fitnathemovie.info/timeline.php|archivedate=2008-03-06|df=}}</ref>
Wilders is the subject of a [[fatwa]], associated with [[Al-Qaeda]], calling upon [[Muslim]]s to assassinate him in the name of [[Islam]].<ref name="jihad_wilders">{{Cite web|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5660323/Wilders-death-threats-confirmed |title=Wilders death threats confirmed |accessdate=2008-03-28 |publisher=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]] |date=2008-02-27 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080302035335/http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5660323/Wilders-death-threats-confirmed |archivedate=2008-03-02 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref name="jihad_wilders2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/3405995/_Jihad_tegen_Wilders__.html?p=1,1|title=Jihad tegen Wilders|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[De Telegraaf]], Netherlands|date=2008-02-27|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref name="alqaedafatwa">{{cite web|url=http://www.nisnews.nl/public/280208_5.htm |title='Al Qaeda Fatwa against MP Wilders' |date=2008-02-28 |accessdate=2008-03-08 |work=NIS News Bulletin |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080302014937/http://www.nisnews.nl/public/280208_5.htm |archivedate=2008-03-02 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
====Network Solutions website suspension==== On 5 March 2008, a preliminary version of the movie's official website, fitnathemovie.com, went online.<ref name="fitnathemovie_live">{{cite news|url=http://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCAL0522616520080305|title=Dutch want Koran film shown but fear reactions: poll|accessdate=2008-04-01|publisher=Reuters|date=2008-03-05}}</ref><ref name="fitnathemovie_live2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5670625/Wilders-film-website-goes-online |title=Wilders' film website goes online |accessdate=2008-04-01 |publisher=Radio Netherlands Worldwide |date=2008-03-05 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080309154502/http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5670625/Wilders-film-website-goes-online |archivedate=2008-03-09 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> The only page on the site consisted of a picture of the Qur'an accompanied by the text "Geert Wilders presents Fitna" and "Coming soon". On 22 March, the hosting provider of the website, [[Network Solutions]], replaced the page with a message stating that the company “is investigating whether the site's content is in violation of the Network Solutions [[Acceptable use policy|Acceptable Use Policy]]” and that “Network Solutions has received a number of complaints regarding this site that are under investigation.”<ref name="NetworkSolutions_takedown">{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20080323/film_nm/islam_wilders_site_dc |title=Web host suspends site planned for anti-Koran film |date=2008-03-22 |accessdate=2008-03-24 |work=[[Reuters]] |publisher=[[Yahoo! News]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080324191733/http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20080323/film_nm/islam_wilders_site_dc |archivedate=March 24, 2008 }}</ref><ref name="NetworkSolutions_takedown2">{{cite news|url=http://blog.washingtonpost.com/securityfix/2008/03/networksolutions_precensors_an.html |title=Network Solutions Pre-Censors Anti-Islam Site |date=2008-03-23 |accessdate=2008-03-24 |work=[[Washington Post]] |first=Brian |last=Krebs |deadurl=yes |df= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080515180335/http://blog.washingtonpost.com/securityfix/2008/03/networksolutions_precensors_an.html |archivedate=2008-05-15 }}</ref><ref name="NetworkSolutions_takedown3">{{cite news|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/03/23/europe/EU-GEN-Netherlands-Quran-Film.php|title=Web site for Dutch anti-Quran film suspended by host|work=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[International Herald Tribune]]|date=2008-03-22|accessdate=2008-03-24}}</ref>
On March 24, Network Solutions issued a press release saying the company asked Wilders for a copy of the film to review to gauge compliance with the Acceptable Use Policy, and it was only after they received no response from Wilders that they suspended the website.<ref name="Network Solutions Press Release">{{cite news|url=http://newsroom.networksolutions.com/2008/network-solutions-statement-on-fitnathemoviecom/|date=2008-03-24|accessdate=2008-03-27|work=[[Network Solutions]]|title=Network Solutions’ Statement Regarding the Suspension of Fitnathemovie.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.computerworld.com/action/article.do?command=viewArticleBasic&articleId=9071659&intsrc=hm_list|title=Network Solutions suspends anti-Islamist film Web site|first=Linda|last=Rosencrance|work=[[Computerworld]]|date=2008-03-25|accessdate=2008-03-27}}</ref> Wilders responded saying he had other options available and that his film would be made public before 1 April.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2008/03/wilders_website_provider_wants.php|title=Network Solutions wants to see the film|accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> The shutdown was followed by extensive criticism of Network Solutions' alleged hypocrisy in hosting the domain of [[Hezbollah]], an entity that the United States and the Netherlands (along with four other countries) designate as a [[List of designated terrorist organizations#List of terrorist organizations|terrorist organization]].<ref name="nlfas">{{cite web|url=http://www.fas.org/irp/world/netherlands/aivd2004-eng.pdf|title=Annual Report 2004|publisher=Netherlands General intelligence and security service|accessdate=2008-03-25|date=2005-01-01|format=PDF}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.state.gov/s/ct/rls/fs/37191.htm |title=Foreign Terrorist Organizations (FTOs) |accessdate=2006-07-16 |date=2005-10-11 |publisher=[[United States Department of State]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060712173350/http://www.state.gov/s/ct/rls/fs/37191.htm |archivedate=2006-07-12 |deadurl=yes |df= }} "Current List of Designated Foreign Terrorist Organizations ... 14. Hizballah (Party of God)".</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://blog.washingtonpost.com/securityfix/2008/03/networksolutions_precensors_an.html |title=Network Solutions Pre-Censors Anti-Islam Site |date=2008-03-23 |accessdate=2008-03-30 |first=Brian |last=Krebs |work=[[Washington Post]] |deadurl=yes |df= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080515180335/http://blog.washingtonpost.com/securityfix/2008/03/networksolutions_precensors_an.html |archivedate=2008-05-15 }}</ref> On March 26, Network Solutions shut down the hizbollah.org domain as well.<ref name="NetworkSolutions_takedown2"/>
==After the release== The reaction was mild in comparison with what was expected, with some Muslim delegates describing it as “not as jarring as anticipated”, saying they were “extremely relieved”.<ref name="apafterfitna">{{cite news|url=http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5gbdWDY3d2pIF8SJM8-HhVKSIJz3wD8VM07T81 |title=Dutch Lawmaker Releases Anti-Quran Film |first=Toby |last=Sterling |work=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[Google News]] |date=2008-03-27 |accessdate=2008-03-27 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080419034742/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5gbdWDY3d2pIF8SJM8-HhVKSIJz3wD8VM07T81 |archivedate=2008-04-19 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref name="dnfitna">{{cite news|url=http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2008/03/wilders_film_within_the_law_sa.php|title='Fitna' within the law, says Muslim group|date=2008-03-27|accessdate=2008-03-27|work=DutchNews.nl|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080403000814/http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2008/03/wilders_film_within_the_law_sa.php|archivedate=2008-04-03|df=}}</ref> A worldwide violent reaction did not materialise, in stark contrast with threats made by Islamic leaders in the months before the release of the film.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,342470,00.html|title=First Reactions to Dutch Anti-Quran Film Are Muted|date=2008-03-27|accessdate=2008-03-27|work=[[Fox News Channel]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/currentaffairs/region/middleeast/080327-fitna-response-mc|title=Moderate response to anti-Islam movie|work=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]]|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-03-30}}</ref> Death threats did occur against Wilders and the company that hosted the film. {{Citation needed|date=April 2008}}
===In the Netherlands=== In a televised reaction following the release, Jan Peter Balkenende, Prime Minister of the Netherlands, gave his reaction on behalf of the Dutch government.<ref name="genaff">{{cite news|url=http://www.minaz.nl/english/News/Press_releases_and_news_items/2008/Maart/Government_s_reaction_to_Wilders_film |title=(Dutch) Government's reaction to Wilders' film |date=2008-03-27 |accessdate=2008-03-27 |work=[[Ministry of General Affairs]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080404045120/http://www.minaz.nl/english/News/Press_releases_and_news_items/2008/Maart/Government_s_reaction_to_Wilders_film |archivedate=2008-04-04 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Amongst other things, it stated:<blockquote> The film equates Islam with violence. We reject this interpretation. The vast majority of Muslims reject extremism and violence. In fact, the victims are often also Muslims... ...We therefore regret that Mr Wilders has released this film. We believe it serves no purpose other than to cause offence.<ref name="genaff"/></blockquote> Dutch parliamentarians of the largest political parties, [[Pieter van Geel]] ([[Christian Democratic Appeal|CDA]]), Mariëtte Hamer ([[Labour Party (Netherlands)|PvdA]]) and [[Mark Rutte]] ([[People's Party for Freedom and Democracy|VVD]]) stated that it was sad that the film did not present any solutions to current problems in the Dutch society - integration of Muslim immigrants and Muslim extremism - and invited Mr. Wilders to discuss possible solutions in the parliament.<ref name="nova27">{{cite news|url=http://novatv.nl/index.cfm?ln=nl&fuseaction=videoaudio.details&reportage_id=5923&CFID=39188582&CFTOKEN=29478978|title=Fitna is released, how does the Netherlands and the world react?|language=Dutch|work=[[Nova (Dutch TV series)|Nova]]|publisher=[[Nederlandse Omroep Stichting|NOS]] [[VARA (broadcaster)|Vara]]|date=2008-03-27|accessdate=2008-03-27}}</ref> In a later parliamentary debate to discuss Balkenende's televised reaction, they expressed further opinions, calling the film 'cunningly made with evil intentions' (CDA), 'a message of fear beyond compare' (PvDA) and 'paranoid' (SP). Wilders was described as a 'political pyromaniac' (VVD) and a 'fearful man' ([[Democrats 66|D66]]).<ref name="nieuwsnl">{{cite news|url=http://www.nieuws.nl/505080|title=Fel Kamerdebat over film Wilders|language=Dutch}}</ref>
According to ''[[Der Spiegel]]'', a speaker for the Muslim organization ''Contactorgaan Moslims en Overheid'' (CMO), Yusuf Altuntas, said that Wilders "is obviously looking to push the limits, but he resists crossing them." For instance, in the film a ripping sound overlaid with imagery of the Qur'an is said to be the ripping of a page from the phone book, and thunder sounds are replacing what might otherwise be perceived as bomb explosion sounds. The Arabic expert Leo Kwarten on the other hand said that "these subtleties may however be lost in the Arabic world."<ref name="populist">{{cite news|url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,543855,00.html|title=Koranfeindliches Video veröffentlicht - Protest gegen Rechtspopulist Wilders|language=German|first=Gerald|last=Traufetter|work=[[Der Spiegel]]|date=2008-03-27|accessdate=2008-03-27}}</ref>
The ''Centraal Joods Overleg'' (Central Jewish Committee) released a statement on March 28, 2008, condemning the film for reinforcing prejudices by implying that all Muslims are terrorists. The Committee said that the portrayal of Muslims in this manner was counterproductive, and that the Dutch Jewish community, along with the Dutch Muslim community and all of Dutch society, has a duty to combat all religious-based terrorism, and to protect everyone against those who wish to overthrow democracy or promote religious hatred.<ref name="cjo1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.cjo.nl/|title=Verklaring Centraal Joods Overleg over de film FITNA|accessdate=2008-04-02|publisher=Centraal Joods Overleg, the Netherlands|language=Dutch|date=2008-03-28}}</ref><ref name="cjo">{{Cite web|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/970768.html|title=Dutch Jews louder than Muslims in condemning 'Fitna' film|accessdate=2008-04-02|publisher=[[Haaretz]], Israel|date=2008-04-02}}</ref>
Politician, and former Muslim, Ehsan Jami had intended to release an [[animated cartoon]] entitled ''The Life of Mohammed'' on April 20, 2008.<ref name="jamihitler">{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/3681412/__Jami_ziet_af_van_Mohammed-tekenfilm___.html|title='Jami ziet af van Mohammed-tekenfilm'|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=[[De Telegraaf]], Netherlands|date=2008-03-31}}</ref> The film, critical of Islam and Muhammad, was to depict Muhammad as a "sexual pervert" for the consummation of his marriage to [[Aisha]] when she was nine or ten years old at the time. In one clip, Muhammad is shown with an [[erection]], taking the girl to a mosque adorned with a [[Swastika#As the symbol of Nazism|Nazi swastika]], in preparation of her deflowering.<ref name="jamigirl">{{Cite web|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/binnenland/3666033/_Minister_doet_een_beroep_op_Jami__.html|title=Minister vraagt Jami af te zien van islamfilm|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=[[De Telegraaf]], Netherlands|date=2008-03-29|language=Dutch}}</ref> Following calls from the [[Ministry of Justice and Security|Minister of Justice]], [[Ernst Hirsch Ballin]], to not increase tension in society, Jami decided against its release. He spoke of his fears that the Dutch police would be unable to adequately protect his safety, and of the possibility of a fatwa calling for his death being issued by Iran.<ref name="jami">{{Cite web|url=http://www.volkskrant.nl/binnenland/article521586.ece/Jami_ziet_af_van_animatiefilm_tegen_islam|title=Jami ziet af van animatiefilm tegen islam|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=[[De Volkskrant]], Netherlands|date=2008-03-31|language=Dutch}}</ref><ref name="jaminis">{{Cite web|url=http://www.nisnews.nl/public/020408_1.htm |title=Film 'Worse than Fitna' Abandoned over Fatwa Fear |accessdate=2008-04-04 |publisher=NIS, Netherlands |date=2008-04-02 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080408101344/http://www.nisnews.nl/public/020408_1.htm |archivedate=2008-04-08 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The Dutch Islamic Federation petitioned a judge for a judgement on Geert Wilders on allegations of [[Hate speech|hate speech law]] violations.<ref name="dutchshrug">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1726155,00.html|title=Dutch Shrug for Anti-Muslim Film|first=Lauren|last=Comiteau|date=2008-03-30|accessdate=2008-04-08|work=[[TIME Magazine]]}}</ref> Wilders was found not guilty of spreading hate.<ref name="wildersclear">{{cite news|url=http://www.expatica.com/nl/articles/news/Judge-clears-Wilders-of-spreading-hate.html|title=Judge clears Wilders of spreading hate|date=2008-04-07|accessdate=2008-04-08|work=expatica}}</ref>
In November 2008, a pamphlet that was distributed to children aged 10–12 years compared ''Fitna'' to ''[[Mein Kampf]]'', stating that "Geert Wilders’ film Fitna and Adolf Hitler’s Mein Kampf are based upon one-sided points-of-view. Fortunately there are also other books and plays that -on the contrary- show respect for people with other ideas or faiths or that look different." <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hudsonny.org/2008/11/wilders-is-hitler.php |title=Wilders is Hitler |accessdate=2008-11-05 |publisher=Hudson New York |date=2008-11-03}}</ref>
===Africa=== In [[Algeria]], the Minister for Religious Affairs said that ''Fitna'' is "a recurrent expression of the fascism which is abhorred by all cultures", and the country's imams have been ordered to denounce the film.<ref name="algeria">{{Cite web|url=http://www.magharebia.com/cocoon/awi/xhtml1/en_GB/features/awi/features/2008/04/02/feature-01|title=Algerians join international outrage over "Fitna" film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Magharebia]]|date=2008-04-02}}</ref>
In [[Egypt]], Foreign minister referred to Wilders' film as "a humiliation" to Islam, calling it "nothing less than repugnant," and stating that "Egypt rejects any offence or denigration of Islam and its prophet."<ref name="arabsdenounce" /><ref name="mwl">{{Cite web|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2008/891/eg5.htm|title=Blasted backlash|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=[[Al-Ahram]]|date=2008-03-30|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080408102846/http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2008/891/eg5.htm|archive-date=2008-04-08|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
President [[Omar al-Bashir]] of [[Sudan]] called on Muslims to "challenge those who insult" Muhammad, and asked for "a binding international charter" for the respect of religious beliefs. al-Bashir continued: ""The offenses against our Arab and Islamic nations under the banner of freedom of expression are derogatory and defamatory and go against all human values."<ref name="arabsdenounce">{{Cite web|url=http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hvjTyyTBwAmgI4o2OKkJTIjX5pEgD8VNDF8G0 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130124145102/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5hvjTyyTBwAmgI4o2OKkJTIjX5pEgD8VNDF8G0 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-01-24 |title=Arabs Denounce Dutch Anti-Islam Film |accessdate=2008-04-04 |publisher=[[Associated Press]] |date=2008-03-30 }}</ref>
===Asia===
====Central Asia==== [[Murat Ali Jumanov]], the Grand [[Mufti]] of [[Kyrgyzstan]], denounced the film, saying that it defames Islam and the Koran. He urged Kyrgyzstan's Muslim population to counter the hostility of the film's release.<ref name="kyrgyzstan">{{Cite web|url=http://mathaba.net/news/?x=587534|title=Kyrgyz grand Mufti condemns anti-Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=Mathaba|date=2008-04-02}}</ref>
====South Asia==== The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Bangladesh "condemned in the strongest terms" the release of ''Fitna''. It said that "Islam is a faith of peace which preaches patience and understanding," and the film's "unwarranted and mindless release can have grave consequences."<ref name="mofa">{{Cite web|url=http://www.mofa.gov.bd/Adviser%20press%20release.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070426024913/http://www.mofa.gov.bd/Adviser%20press%20release.htm |archive-date=2007-04-26 |title=Foreign Ministry strongly condemns the posting of Dutch film on Holy Quran on the web |accessdate=2008-04-04 |publisher=Bangladesh Ministry of Foreign Affairs |date=2008-03-28 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
In an editorial for the independent English-language Bangladeshi newspaper ''[[Weekly Blitz]]'', under the editorship of [[Salah Choudhury]], there were many opinions expressed in condemnation of the Muslim world's response: "The Muslim world that is vocal and vociferous in its demands for censorship in the West is going through a reenergized paroxysm of anger and hate," the newspaper said, and asked "is it realistic to mandate that 100% of the world’s population must be pro-Koran and pro-Muslim?" The editorial stated that ''Fitna's'' relative artistic or philosophical worth is irrelevant, and that its release is an issue of [[individual rights]], [[freedom of speech]], [[critical thinking]], and the West's cultural inheritance of 3,000 years of civilization. The editorial continued to question Muslim countries' censorship and restriction of free speech, satirically saying that "we should ask them firmly yet politely exactly how they so effectively censor the existing hate speech, the rampant anti-Semitic and anti-West propaganda that fill their media, Mosques, schools and universities on an hourly basis, every day, almost without exclusion." The newspaper noted the hypocrisy of how [[Islam and other religions|Islam interacts with other religions]], saying that Islam has "such unrivaled respect and such unprejudiced consideration for Christianity, Judaism and the rest of the world’s religious cultures and beliefs." It notes that anti-government, pro-democratic, and "moderate or revolutionary speech and actions within their societies" are censored, and that [[multiculturalism]], [[freedom of religion]], and "unqualified personal expression" is prohibited.<ref name="blitz">{{cite news|author=Sacks, Leslie J. |date=2008-04-03 |title=FITNA Unveiled |url=http://www.weeklyblitz.net/index.php?subaction=showfull&id=1207259492&archive=&start_from=&ucat=3&cat=3 |newspaper=The Weekly Blitz |accessdate=2008-04-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080415182903/http://www.weeklyblitz.net/index.php?subaction=showfull&id=1207259492&archive=&start_from=&ucat=3&cat=3 |archivedate=April 15, 2008 }}</ref>
Pakistan called for a discussion of the film at the next [[Organisation of the Islamic Conference]] (OIC) summit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5671207/Pakistan-summons-Dutch-ambassador |title=Pakistan summons Dutch ambassador |date=2008-03-05 |accessdate=2008-03-30 |work=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080308234755/http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5671207/Pakistan-summons-Dutch-ambassador |archivedate=2008-03-08 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> According to the [[Associated Press of Pakistan|APP]], the country's official news agency, the Pakistani foreign minister [[Shah Mehmood Qureshi]] condemned ''Fitna'' as being anti-Islamic. He said that the film was part of a series of incitingly discriminatory actions against Islam, made by the Western media. Quereshi said that the Pakistani government, and its people, are highly sensitive towards such actions made in the name of freedom of expression.<ref name="pakistan01">{{Cite web|url=http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=34207&Itemid=1|title=OIC Secretary General meets foreign minister; commends Pakistan’s role at OIC|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Associated Press of Pakistan]]|date=2008-04-01|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413154049/http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=34207&Itemid=1|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> Outside the [[Karachi Press Club]], an [[effigy]] of Wilders, and the Dutch flag, was burned in a [[protest]].<ref name="pakistan_effigy">{{Cite web|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gW2bRkjxUGmDoS-Fg_0QXicUEIjA|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080418104035/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gW2bRkjxUGmDoS-Fg_0QXicUEIjA|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-04-18|title=Dutch security raised in Pakistan after anti-Islam film: official|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=2008-04-01}}</ref>
In a speech to the [[United Nations Human Rights Council]] (UNHRC) on 1 April, the ambassador and permanent representative of Pakistan to the [[United Nations]], [[Masood Khan]], said that the film was a "blatant provocation," had "distorted the message of the Holy Qur'an," was [[Xenophobia|xenophobic]] and [[Religious intolerance|religiously intolerant]]. He called for the UNHRC to do more than condemn or adopt [[United Nations resolution|resolutions]].<ref name="pakistan_">{{Cite web|url=http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=34264&Itemid=1|title=Pakistan strongly condemns Dutch dostabilitycumentary|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Associated Press of Pakistan]]|date=2008-04-02|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413154055/http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=34264&Itemid=1|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> As such, a Pakistani-sponsored United Nations resolution calling for the monitoring of "abuse of the right of freedom of expression" was successfully passed. The measure was accepted after achieving the required number of votes from Islamic countries, while European countries and Canada [[Abstention|abstained]]. On behalf of the OIC, Khan said that the resolution will require people to exercise their freedom of expression responsibly.<ref name="UNHRC">{{Cite web|url=http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5ibRpZm13vhHxx8a43rVbnc6lsY8wD8VPA6CG0 |title=West and Muslims Clash on Free Speech |accessdate=2008-04-03 |publisher=[[Associated Press]] |date=2008-04-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080405210944/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5ibRpZm13vhHxx8a43rVbnc6lsY8wD8VPA6CG0 |archivedate=April 5, 2008 }}</ref> This drew criticism from [[Reporters Without Borders]], whose press statement read: <blockquote>The growing influence of Organisation of the Islamic Conference member states within the Human Rights Council is disturbing. All of the council’s decisions are nowadays determined by the interests of the Muslim countries or powerful states such as China or Russia that know how to surround themselves with allies.<ref name="rsf">{{Cite web|url=http://www.rsf.org/article.php3?id_article=26390|title=UN Human Rights Council turns special rapporteur on free expression into prosecutor |accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Reporters Without Borders]]|date=2008-03-31}}</ref></blockquote> The secretary-general of the OIC, [[Ekmeleddin İhsanoğlu]], spoke of helping a co-ordinated strategy made by the [[Ummah]], the diaspora of Muslims living in non-Muslim countries, to combat a campaign of defamaing Islam in the West.<ref name=pakistan01 /> İhsanoğlu had previously condemned the film as "causing insult to the sentiments of more than 1.3 billion Muslims in the world," and that it was "a deliberate act of discrimination against Muslims" that would "threaten the security and stability of the world."<ref name="arabsdenounce" /><ref name="oic1">{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/europe/03/28/islam.film/|title= Muslims condemn Dutch lawmaker's film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[CNN]]}}</ref><ref name="oic2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.oic-oci.org/oicnew/topic_detail.asp?t_id=907 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20080404230321/http://www.oic-oci.org/oicnew/topic_detail.asp?t_id=907 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2008-04-04 |title=Statement by H.E. Professor Ekmeleddin Ihsanoglu, Secretary General of the Organization of the Islamic Conference on the release of the blasphemous documentary film ""Fitna"" |accessdate=2008-04-03 |publisher=[[Organisation of the Islamic Conference]] |date=2008-03-28 }}</ref>
On 6 April 2008, five thousand members of the [[Jamaat-e-Islami Pakistan|Jamaat-e-Islami]] political party held a demonstration in [[Karachi]], in protest against both Wilders' film and the Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons. The leader of the political party stated that "such shameful acts can never be tolerated in the name of freedom of expression or press," and asserted that anyone who committed a crime of provoking Muslims should be declared "terrorists".<ref name="karachi1">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idINIndia-32883620080406|title=Pakistanis protest over Danish cartoon, Dutch film|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=2008-04-06}}</ref><ref name="karachi2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5721349/Thousands-demonstrate-against-IFitnaI-in-Karachi |title=Thousands demonstrate against Fitna in Karachi |accessdate=2008-04-06 |publisher=[[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]] |date=2008-04-06 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080411060154/http://www.radionetherlands.nl/news/international/5721349/Thousands-demonstrate-against-IFitnaI-in-Karachi |archivedate=2008-04-11 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
On 3 May 2008, around 5000 Muslims gathered in [[Karachi]], [[Pakistan]] in a protest against Wilder's film, chanting "Death to the [[Blasphemy in Islam|blasphemer]]" and burned an effigy of Wilders. In [[Afghanistan]], the Taliban murdered two Dutch soldiers in retaliation for the film.<ref name="moremilitants">{{Cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/news/articles/politics/international_politics/pakistan+demo+against+islam+film/2129647|title= TPakistan demo against Islam film|accessdate=2008-05-04|publisher=Channel 4 News|date=2008-05-04}}</ref>
====Southeast Asia==== President [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono]] of Indonesia banned Wilders from entering the country, and prohibited the film from being broadcast.<ref name=afpban>{{cite news|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5iTnYl7_-J5uXAP_1d9MdyYCyOcAQ |title=Indonesia bans Dutch filmmaker, warns against violent protest |work=[[Agence France Presse]] |date=11 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080407205141/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5iTnYl7_-J5uXAP_1d9MdyYCyOcAQ |archivedate=April 7, 2008 }}</ref> About 50 members of a hardline Muslim group demonstrated at the Dutch embassy in the Indonesian capital, [[Jakarta]], throwing eggs and water bottles to the embassy compound.<ref name=reural>{{cite news|url=http://africa.reuters.com/world/news/usnJAK292374.html |title=Muslim hardliners in Indonesia rally over Dutch film |work=[[Reuters]] |date=31 March 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080907075817/http://africa.reuters.com/world/news/usnJAK292374.html |archivedate=September 7, 2008 }}</ref> Protesters held signs saying "Death Sentence for Humiliating Islam", amid images of guns aimed at his head,<ref name=guacut>{{cite news |url=http://film.guardian.co.uk/news/story/0,,2270021,00.html |title=Controversial cartoon cut from Dutch MP's film on Islam |work=[[The Guardian]], London |date=1 April 2008}}</ref> and "Kill Geert Wilders".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7322179.stm |title=Dutch MP's film angers Indonesia |work=[[BBC News]] |date=31 March 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080405061708/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7322179.stm |archivedate=April 5, 2008 }}</ref> Indonesia blocked access to YouTube, after its demand that copies of the film be removed from YouTube servers was not implemented.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/04/08/indonesia.youtube/index.html?_s=PM:WORLD |title=Indonesia blocks YouTube to protest Islam film |work=[[CNN]] |date=8 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141124104826/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/04/08/indonesia.youtube/index.html?_s=PM%3AWORLD |archivedate=24 November 2014 |df= }}</ref> The ban was lifted on April 11, following protests and allegations of censorship from users, with Indonesian communications minister Muhammad Nuh apologising for “the inconvenience caused”.<ref name=pdiapol>{{cite news|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/infotech/view/20080411-129778/Indonesia-apologizes-for-YouTube-blockade |title=Indonesia apologizes for YouTube blockade |work=Agence France-Presse |publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]] |date=11 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120404142033/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/infotech/view/20080411-129778/Indonesia-apologizes-for-YouTube-blockade |archivedate=April 4, 2012 }}</ref> Internet Service Providers said that they would instead try to block access to individual pages carrying ''Fitna''.<ref name=smhsor>{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/web/indonesia-says-sorry-for-youtube-block/2008/04/13/1208024963595.html |title=Indonesia says sorry for YouTube block |work=Agence France-Presse |publisher=[[Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=13 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130520204843/http://www.smh.com.au/news/web/indonesia-says-sorry-for-youtube-block/2008/04/13/1208024963595.html |archivedate=May 20, 2013 }}</ref>
On April 2, a Dutch consulate in the Indonesian city of [[Medan]] was the scene of a student protest. The Dutch national flag was torn from its pillar and burned,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2008/04/02/us-dutch-islam-indonesia-idUSSP23588120080402 |title=Indonesia seeks to block YouTube over anti-Koran film |work=[[CNN]] |date=2 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203021915/https://www.reuters.com/article/2008/04/02/us-dutch-islam-indonesia-idUSSP23588120080402 |archivedate=December 3, 2013 }}</ref> and about 50 students broke through the consulate gates.<ref name=cnndam>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/04/02/indonesia.protest/ |title=Dutch consulate damaged in Indonesia protests |work=CNN |date=2 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413132729/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/04/02/indonesia.protest/ |archivedate=April 13, 2008 }}</ref>
In a letter to the state-owned Indonesian news agency [[Antara (news agency)|Antara]], Dutch ambassador [[Nikolaos van Dam]] said how Dutch society is one of peaceful co-existence, with respect for the law, which guarantees safety and freedom of speech and freedom of religion. He said that Holland has a tradition of respect, tolerance and responsibility, and that offending others is not part of that tradition; he called for everyone else to act in a similar spirit. Van Dam also expressed his government's desire to remain in open contact with everyone who wishes peaceful dialogue, to build a society "more firmly grounded in mutual understanding and respect."<ref name=antrej>{{cite web|url=http://www.antara.co.id/en/arc/2008/4/2/dutch-government-rejects-the-film-fitna/ |title=Dutch government rejects the film "Fitna" |work=[[Antara (news agency)|Antara]] |date=2 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080407085918/http://www.antara.co.id/en/arc/2008/4/2/dutch-government-rejects-the-film-fitna/ |archivedate=April 7, 2008 }}</ref>
[[Ahmad Zahid Hamidi]], a member of the [[Cabinet of Malaysia]] government, urged Muslim intellectuals and [[youth]]s to "take advantage of their resourcefulness and skills which they had used against the establishment, this time to defend Islam" through the internet;<ref name=tsmboy>{{cite news|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/4/1/nation/20804686&sec=nation |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080410081148/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2008%2F4%2F1%2Fnation%2F20804686&sec=nation |dead-url=yes |archive-date=10 April 2008 |title=Boycott Dutch products, say consumer groups |work=[[The Star (Malaysia)]] |date=1 April 2008 |df= }}</ref> a reference to when [[Hacker (computer security)|hackers]] defaced a governmental webpage in protest of a proposed ban on [[pornography]].<ref name="indoporn">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKJAK24257120080328|title=Indonesian ministry Web site hacked over porn ban|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=2008-03-28}}</ref> The [[Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party]], an [[opposition (politics)|opposition]] policial party, delivered a letter to the Dutch embassy warning that the film would "invite vengeance", and, along with former president [[Mahathir bin Mohamad]], called for a worldwide Muslim boycott of Dutch goods.<ref name=gooboy>{{cite news|url=http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5iAkl3rsgdXH7ASqzIjuNrb4OTTyAD8VOC91G0 |title=Malaysian Party Urges Dutch Boycott |work=[[Associated Press]] |date=1 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080405210954/http://ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5iAkl3rsgdXH7ASqzIjuNrb4OTTyAD8VOC91G0 |archivedate=April 5, 2008 }}</ref> Bin Mohamad said: "If the world's 1.3 billion Muslims unite and say they won't buy, then it [the boycott] will be effective."<ref name=goomah>{{cite news|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gO-MERVjEHYvKGt6laqxc9G8MrLA |title=Malaysia's Mahathir says Muslims 'annoyed' by Dutch film |work=Agence France-Presse |date=29 March 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080511175019/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5gO-MERVjEHYvKGt6laqxc9G8MrLA |archivedate=May 11, 2008 }}</ref> The ''Muslim Consumers Association of Malaysia'', the ''Consultative Council'', and the ''Muslim Restaurants Association of Malaysia'' released a joint statement referring to ''Fitna'' as having insulted the Koran, and called on Muslims to boycott Dutch goods.<ref name=tsmboy /> Malay supermarket [[Mydin]] has marked Dutch goods in red, indicating their [[country of origin]].<ref name=ihtsup>{{cite news|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/04/01/asia/AS-GEN-Malaysia-Quran-Film.php |title=Malaysian supermarket chain marks Dutch products red to protest anti-Islam film |work=[[International Herald Tribune]] |date=1 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080412083600/http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/04/01/asia/AS-GEN-Malaysia-Quran-Film.php |archivedate=April 12, 2008 }}</ref>
There was a demonstration outside the Dutch embassy in [[Kuala Lumpur]] on 4 April 2008, attended by approximately fifty members of the Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party. Slogans such as "Long live Islam" and "Crush the Netherlands" were shouted. A leader of the political party said: "He wants to insult Islam, insult our prophet, insult our Quran," and called for a fatwa ordering Wilders' death. The Dutch ambassador's response was: "The call for the death of Mr Wilders is a very emotional one, which in no way can be justified."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/04/04/business/AS-GEN-Malaysia-Quran-Film.php |title=Muslim protestors protest against Dutch lawmaker for insulting Quran |work=Associated Press |publisher=International Herald Tribune |date=4 April 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080412083605/http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/04/04/business/AS-GEN-Malaysia-Quran-Film.php |archivedate=April 12, 2008 }}</ref>
[[Singapore]] issued a statement strongly condemning the film, with deputy prime minister [[Wong Kan Seng]] saying: "Freedom of expression does not give anyone the licence to insult another's religion or race."<ref name=goomah />
====West Asia==== The [[Bahrain News Agency]], the government-operated news agency for [[Bahrain]], released a statement regarding the film. Through the [[Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs (Bahrain)|Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs]], the government referred to Wilders as slanderous, and that ''Fitna'' was part of "the escalating hostility and unjust war waged from time to time against Islam." The Supreme Council called for "peaceful protests that reflect the civilized aspect of Islam," and recommended dialogue with the West to "spread the true tenets of Islam and shed light on the life and precepts of prophet Mohammed." The Supreme Council also called for Islamic countries and the Organisation of the Islamic Conference to push for a United Nations resolution to criminalise [[Islam and blasphemy|blasphemy against Islam]], "for the sake of global peace and harmony".<ref name="bahrain">{{Cite web|url=http://english.bna.bh/?ID=68613|title=SUPREME COUNCIL FOR ISLAMIC AFFAIRS CONDEMNS DEFAMATION OF ISLAM|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=Bahrain News Agency|date=2008-04-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413163550/http://english.bna.bh/?ID=68613|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
[[Mohammad Ali Hosseini]], a spokesman for Iran's ministry of foreign affairs said ''Fitna'' was "heinous", blasphemous, and that its release "is indicative of the continuation of the evilness and deep vengeance such Western nationals have against Islam and Muslims."<ref name="iran1">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSBLA83556420080328|title=Iran condemns "heinous" Dutch Koran film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=2008-03-28}}</ref> Iran's government spokesperson, [[Gholam-Hossein Elham]], said that "The new wave of the fight against Islam and promoting Islamophobia, which was started by the U.S., has so far opposite effects in the world of Islam as well as other parts of the globe."<ref name="elham">{{Cite web|url=http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/line-17/0804050639151609.htm|title=Anti-Islamic campaign has opposite effect: spokesman|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=[[Islamic Republic News Agency]]|date=2008-04-05|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413095550/http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/line-17/0804050639151609.htm|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> Elham stated that the governments 'of the countries where the anti-Islamic moves have been made' would, in future, prevent any further actions against Islam, saying that 'insults against the holy prophet of Islam and the divine religion were against the principles of freedom of expression'.<ref name="elham" /> In [[Tehran]], approximately seventy members of the paramilitary force [[Basij]] protested outside the Dutch embassy. They chanted slogans such as "Down with USA", "Down with Israel", "Dutch Ambassador to Iran Should Be Expelled", and called for the closure of [[Royal Dutch Shell]] and [[Philips]]. A spokesperson for the protesters said that the release of the film was a ploy by [[Imperialism|imperialists]] to harm Muslim countries, insult Muhammad, and stage a [[Crusades|Crusade]], adding: "We will never remain silent in the face of ploys by domestic or foreign enemies.<ref name="basij">{{Cite web|url=http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/menu-234/0804052903192457.htm|title=Basiji students protest anti-Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=[[Islamic Republic News Agency]]|date=2008-04-05|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413095600/http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/menu-234/0804052903192457.htm|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref name="tehranafp">{{Cite web|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5iwbYYutDQzako7L0dp89SVOPPRKw|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080418023051/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5iwbYYutDQzako7L0dp89SVOPPRKw|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-04-18|title=Iranian students protest outside Dutch embassy|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=2008-04-05}}</ref> During a [[Khutba|sermon]] on 4 April, broadcast on Iranian state radio, [[Ayatollah]] [[Ahmad Khatami]] accused the "[[Zionist entity]]" of ''Fitna's'' making and release. He said: "Behind these satanic acts can be found the oppressive powers and the Zionist regime." Of Wilders, Khatami said: "This poor Dutch deputy has made 40 trips to Israel over the past 25 years." Khatami concluded that "we see the hand of the Zionist regime behind these satanic acts and we cry 'death to Israel'." He stated that ''Fitna'' and the Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons were a reaction against the "blossoming of Islam," and that "these films and caricatures are disseminated under the pretext of freedom of information in Europe. This is a great lie of Western liberal democracy, because anyone who speaks out against the official version of the Holocaust is jailed," referring to [[Holocaust denial]].<ref name="ayatollah">{{Cite web|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5jMxGMEefDaPXWWuHvUTZCnbCCvUA|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080418014531/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5jMxGMEefDaPXWWuHvUTZCnbCCvUA|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-04-18|title=Iran cleric says Israel behind anti-Islam Dutch film|accessdate=2008-04-05|publisher=[[Agence France-Presse]]|date=2208-04-04}}</ref> Khatami spoke of a Europe actively engaged in defaming Islam, saying that "there is a catchy disease spreading in Europe today, whose victims feel obliged to insult Islam and to fight against the Muslims," mentioning the conversion of [[Magdi Allam]] from Islam to [[Catholicism]] as further proof of his statements. He claimed that European "plans" that had been "devised for hundreds of years have borne absolutely no fruit, which is the reason why they have begun conducting such wretched moves." Khatami said that "such moves are made in Europe under the cover of freedom of expression prove that such a freedom does not exist there, since as soon as an intellectual begins talking about the [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]], they put him to trial, condemn his move, and imprison him." He claimed that Islam in the Netherlands is increasing, saying that "the Dutch have also bought a large number of electronic versions of Qur'an in their own language and a large number of people in Holland have openly announced they have converted to Islam."<ref name="ayatollah2">{{Cite web|url=http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/menu-234/0804047792170302.htm|title=Major cleric: Iran's 3 islands to remain Iranian for good|accessdate=2008-04-05|publisher=[[Islamic Republic News Agency]]|date=2008-04-04|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413095555/http://www2.irna.ir/en/news/view/menu-234/0804047792170302.htm|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
53 parliamentarians of [[Jordan]] have signed a petition, calling on Prime Minister [[Nader Dahabi]] to expel the Dutch ambassador and sever all diplomatic ties with Holland.<ref name="jordan1">{{Cite web|url=http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5i99C3OK1-OtGnUo8vRsmMi99RMYg|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080418022306/http://afp.google.com/article/ALeqM5i99C3OK1-OtGnUo8vRsmMi99RMYg|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2008-04-18|title=Jordan slams Dutch MP's Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-01|publisher=Agence France Presse|date=2008-03-31}}</ref><ref name="jordan">{{Cite web|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/03/30/africa/ME-GEN-Jordan-Netherlands-Quran-Film.php|title=Jordanian MPs demand cutting ties with Netherlands to protest Dutch film|accessdate=2008-04-01|publisher=International Herald Tribune|date=2008-03-30}}</ref> Jordan also summoned Wilders to court, as Fitna was deemed to incite hatred.<ref>http://www.expatica.com/nl/articles/news/Jordan-to-prosecute-Wilders-on-Fitna.html</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2008/06/wilders_may_face_arrest_by_jor.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-02-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090214155134/http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2008/06/wilders_may_face_arrest_by_jor.php |archivedate=2009-02-14 |df= }}</ref>
The Dutch ambassador of [[Qatar]] said that: "In Holland, we have full freedom of expression. There is absolutely no censorship. People are expected to behave responsibly and those who cross the limits will be accountable for their actions."<ref name="qatar">{{Cite web|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=210707&version=1&template_id=57&parent_id=56|title=Dutch MP may face charges over anti-Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Gulf Times]]|date=2008-04-02|author=K T Chacko|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413010924/http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=210707&version=1&template_id=57&parent_id=56|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
The [[Saudi Arabia]]n embassy in [[The Hague]] called the film provocative and "full of errors", that could ultimately lead to hatred of Muslims.<ref name="saudi_condemn">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idINIndia-32732420080329|title=Muslim nations condemn Dutch Koran film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=2008-03-28 | first=Niclas | last=Mika}}</ref>
The [[Directorate of Religious Affairs]] in [[Turkey]] condemned the film as being 'incompatible with freedom of speech and thought', saying that it "aimed to portray Muslims as potential terrorists and to gradually exclude them from the [[international community]]." The Directorate said that "Islam is unfortunately face-to-face with a new 'fitna' due to the film, which promotes discrimination, hatred and violence." It continued to say that the film's objective was to create worldwide prejudice against Islam, and that "it is a serious indication of irresponsibility that in the film negative implications are directed at Muslim religious scholars, who never refrain from sharing their knowledge on religion with the Dutch government." The Directorate said that followers of other religions also did not accept the notion that [[terrorism]] is associated with Muslims, and that "this is an auspicious development for restoring peace among different cultures in the world."<ref name="zaman">{{Cite web|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=138102|title=Religious Affairs Directorate blasts anti-Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-04|publisher=[[Today's Zaman]]|date=2008-04-04|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080605015617/http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=138102|archive-date=2008-06-05|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
[[UAE|United Arab Emirates]] Foreign minister, [[Abdullah Bin Zayed Al Nahyan]], condemned the film as being critical and insulting to Muhammad.<ref name="uae">{{Cite web|url=http://story.malaysiasun.com/index.php/ct/9/cid/b8de8e630faf3631/id/342914/cs/1/|title=World leaders criticise Dutch anti-Koran film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[The Sun (Malaysia)]]|date=2008-03-30|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080413000721/http://story.malaysiasun.com/index.php/ct/9/cid/b8de8e630faf3631/id/342914/cs/1/|archive-date=2008-04-13|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
The [[Yemen]]i parliament condemned the film, calling it inflammatory, [[Discrimination|discriminatory]] towards Muslims, and promoting religious violence and hatred, whilst stressing the need to respect all religions, cultures, and civilizations without prejudice.<ref name="yemeni">{{Cite web|url=http://www.yobserver.com/reports/10014012.html|title=Anti-Quran film deepens chasm between East and West|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=Yemeni Observer|date=2008-04-01|author=Fares Anam}}</ref>
===Europe=== In Denmark, [[Kurt Westergaard]], the cartoonist from one of the [[Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons controversy|Jyllands-Posten cartoons of Muhammed]], has expressed concerns because his cartoon is used in the film without his permission, a violation of copyright.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://jp.dk/indland/article1304784.ece|title=Journalistforbund hjælper Westergaard|language=Danish|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-03-28|work=[[Ritzau]]}}</ref> The Danish Union of Journalists has said it will file a lawsuit on Westergaard's behalf as he is still in hiding from the death threats against him.<ref name="union">{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2008/03/28/wgert228.xml|title=Danish cartoonist to sue Dutch MP over anti-Islamic film|author=Moore, Matthew|author2=Waterfield, Bruno|author3= Clements, Joan|date=2008-03-29|accessdate=2008-03-28|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] | location=London}}</ref> Westergaard says his cartoon was aimed against [[Islamic Terrorism|Islamic terrorists]], not against Muslims.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUSL2618773120080326?pageNumber=1&virtualBrandChannel=0&sp=true|title=Danish Prophet cartoonist says has no regrets|date=2008-03-26|accessdate=2008-03-27|first=Kim|last=McLaughlin|work=[[Reuters]]}}</ref> Similarly Dutch director [[:nl:Rob Muntz|Rob Muntz]] announced to file a lawsuit because of the uncredited use of his interview with [[Theo van Gogh (film director)|Theo van Gogh]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/252338/After_The_Release_of_Fitna_Wilders_Faces_Numerous_Lawsuits|title=After The Release of Fitna, Wilders Faces Numerous Lawsuits|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-03-30|work=Digital Journal|first=Can|last=Tran}}</ref> Westergaard drew a new cartoon showing Geert Wilders with a bomb on his head and a sign saying "Danger! Freedom of expression".<ref name="westerwilders">{{cite news|url=http://www.spitsnieuws.nl/archives/binnenland/2008/03/westergaard_tekent_wilders.html |title=Westergaard tekent Wilders |date=2008-03-31 |accessdate=2008-04-01 |first=J. |last=Peters |work=SpitsNieuws |language=Dutch |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110623140738/http://www.spitsnieuws.nl/archives/binnenland/2008/03/westergaard_tekent_wilders.html |archivedate=2011-06-23 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The [[Norway|Norwegian]] government ([[Norwegian Labour Party|Labour Party]]) sharply distanced itself from the movie.<ref>{{cite news |author= Dalen, Astrid |title= Wilders' anti-islamfilm fjernet i natt |url= http://www.aftenposten.no/nyheter/uriks/article2335114.ece |format= online edition |work= |publisher= ''[[Aftenposten]]'' |location= [[Oslo]], [[Norway]] |id= |pages= |page= |date= March 29, 2008 |accessdate=2008-03-29 |language= Norwegian |quote= Også den norske regjeringen tar skarp avstand fra den anti-islamske filmen.}}</ref> [[Secretary of state]] [[Raymond Johansen]] from the [[Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs|Norwegian Foreign Ministry]] said in a statement to the newspaper ''[[Dagsavisen]]'' that "Wilders attempts to promote a content which contributes to hatred and suspicion. I profoundly disagree with the content, and I sharply distance myself from it."<ref>{{cite news |author1=Hanssen, Sturla Smári |author2=Selmer, Erik R. |title= Norge tar avstand fra islamfilm |url= http://www.dagsavisen.no/utenriks/article341280.ece |format= online edition |work= |publisher= ''[[Dagsavisen]]'' |location= [[Oslo]], [[Norway]] |id= |pages= |page= |date= March 29, 2008 |accessdate=2008-03-29 |language= Norwegian |quote= }}</ref> [[Per-Willy Amundsen]], Spokesperson on Immigration Issues of the opposition [[Progress Party (Norway)|Progress Party]], however found the film largely correct, and challenged Johansen to present what that was false about it.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dagsavisen.no/utenriks/article341280.ece|title=Norge tar avstand fra islamfilm|work=Dagsavisen|first=Sturla Smári Hanssenerik R.|last=Selmer|date=29 March 2008}}</ref>
[[UK|United Kingdom]]: Foreign Minister [[David Miliband]] announced his commitment to the “European values of freedom of speech” but said “[[European Union|in each of our countries]]” there are legal checks to ensure speech could not incite religious or racial hatred.<ref name="britishdrawn">{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article3640828.ece|title=Britain drawn into controversy over anti-Islam video by Geert Wilders|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-04-01|first=Michael|last=Theodoulou|work=[[The Times]] | location=London}}</ref>
===Oceania=== [[Australia]]n Minister for foreign affairs, [[Stephen Smith (Australian politician)|Stephen Smith]], "deplored" the film's release, saying that it is "an obvious attempt to generate discord between faith communities," and accused it of [[incitement to ethnic or racial hatred|inciting racial hatred]].<ref name="australia">{{Cite web|url=http://news.theage.com.au/australia-denounces-antiislam-film/20080330-22gl.html|title=Australia denounces anti-Islam film|accessdate=2008-04-03|publisher=[[The Age]]|date=2008-03-30|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080403235956/http://news.theage.com.au/australia-denounces-antiislam-film/20080330-22gl.html|archive-date=2008-04-03|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
===South America=== [[Suriname]]: With 22% of its population being Muslim. Suriname has the highest Islamic population by percentage in the [[New World]]. The Surinamese agreement of Muslims launched a statement which said: "We regret the fact that the Dutch MP Geert wilders abuses feelings of fear and ignorance across the white Dutch population by insulting en bashing the Islam systematically....His latest provocation (the film Fitna) is a insult to the Islam and its 1,3 billion followers across the world".<ref name=" Surinaamse moslimgemeenschap Wilders film ">{{cite news|url= http://www.nospang.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&Itemid=23&id=5150&ccdate=6-4-2008|language=Dutch}}</ref>
===International organizations=== After the release of the film, a number of international organizations released statements or otherwise responded to the film. [[The United Nations|United Nations']] [[United Nations Secretary-General|Secretary-General]] [[Ban Ki-moon]] stated on March 28, 2008 that {{Quote|I condemn, in the strongest terms, the airing of Geert Wilders’ offensively anti-Islamic film. There is no justification for hate speech or incitement to violence. The right of free expression is not at stake here. I acknowledge the efforts of the Government of the Netherlands to stop the broadcast of this film, and appeal for calm to those understandably offended by it. Freedom must always be accompanied by social responsibility.<ref name="bkmUN">{{cite news|url=https://www.un.org/News/Press/docs/2008/sgsm11483.doc.htm|title=NO JUSTIFICATION FOR HATE SPEECH OR INCITEMENT, SAYS SECRETARY-GENERAL; IN STRONG CONDEMNATION OF ‘ANTI-ISLAMIC’ FILM|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-04-02|work=[[United Nations|UN News Centre]]}}</ref><ref name="bkm">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/topNews/idUSN2844232220080328?feedType=RSS&feedName=topNews&rpc=22&sp=true|title=U.N.'s Ban condemns Dutch film as anti-Islamic|date=2008-03-28|accessdate=2008-03-28|first=Lewis|last=Krauskopf|work=[[Reuters]]}}</ref>}} In its statement, The Muslim World League said that ''Fitna's'' release was "[an] offensive act that aims to spread discord between people."<ref name="mwl" /> The [[European Union|European Union’s]] [[Slovenia]]n president repudiated the film, commenting that it served “no other purpose than inflaming hatred”. The EU foreign ministers also condemned the film. “The film equates Islam with violence and this view is sharply rejected”, the ministers said in their statement, released after a meeting in Brdo, Slovenia.<ref>{{cite news|title=EU foreign ministers condemn Dutch film on Islam |url=http://www.euractiv.com/en/culture/eu-foreign-ministers-condemn-dutch-film-islam/article-171227 |date=2008-03-31 |accessdate=2008-03-31 |publisher=EurActiv.com}}.</ref> Europe’s highest human rights authority, the [[Strasbourg]] based [[Council of Europe]], called the film “a distasteful manipulation which exploits ignorance, prejudice and fear”.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/2008/03/29/top8.htm|title=Anti-Islam film assailed widely|date=2008-03-29|accessdate=2008-03-30|first=Rabi|last=ul-Awwal|work=dawn.com}}</ref>
Lengthier responses were released by the [[Arab European League]] and the Union of NGOs of the Islamic World.
====Union of NGOs of the Islamic World==== The [[Union of NGOs of the Islamic World]] (UNIW) issued a press release, stating that the film "heavily included insults to the Holy Qur’an and to the Islamic values." The UNIW said that distribution of such [[Islamophobia|Islamophobic]] material, as well as other forms of Islamophobia such as the [[Play (theatre)|theatrical]] interpretation of Salman Rushdie's [[novel]], ''[[The Satanic Verses]]'', and the Jyllands-Posten Muhammad cartoons, should be banned in Europe. It said that "humiliation of the values that are held in high esteem by people cannot be justified by the freedom of speech" or [[art|artistic expression]]. It stated that "freedom of speech and disseminating ideas do not amount to the right to insult," and that no-one's "sacred values" should be humiliated. It went on to call for European states to "not give permission to such publications, broadcasts and policies," and asked that they "take the necessary regulations that shall regard the Islamophobic acts and incidents as a crime." The UNIW likened Islamophobia to antisemitism and its legal status in Europe, saying that if Islamophobia and Islamophobic publications are not made illegal, "marginal extremist-racist groups that are after discrimination may be strengthened." It said that Islamophobia is an infringement of [[human rights]], and "a perilous discrimination." It said: <blockquote>The reason why Muslim public opinion have not overreacted to these aforementioned broadcasts, policies and events is that they have a common sense stemming from their belief. Nevertheless, it does not mean that they shall never react. It should be ensured that Muslim public opinion react to these all the Anti-Islamist broadcasts, policies and acts through peaceful means.</blockquote> The UNIW called on Europe "to use their common sense and heed, and to revise their attitudes in order to build social peace." <ref name="uniw">{{Cite web|url=http://www.theunity.org/en/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=239:european-governments-must-not-give-countenance-to-anti-islamism&catid=2:basn-acklamalar&Itemid=3|title= EUROPEAN GOVERNMENTS MUST NOT GIVE COUNTENANCE TO ANTI-ISLAMISM!|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=Union of NGOs of the Islamic World|date=2008-04-01|author=UNIW Press Release}}</ref><ref name="uniw2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=138299|title=UNIW’s Sadıkoğlu: European states must not tolerate anti-Islam activities|accessdate=2008-04-06|publisher=[[Today's Zaman]]|date=2008-04-04|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080417235358/http://www.todayszaman.com/tz-web/detaylar.do?load=detay&link=138299|archive-date=2008-04-17|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref>
====Arab European League==== The [[Arab European League]] released a short film, ''Al Mouftinoun'', in response to ''Fitna''. It was released March 28 on [[YouTube]], one day after ''Fitna'' was released. ''Al Mouftinoun'' criticizes Fitna's director Wilders as a [[racism|racist]]. The film was created by the AEL because they find that [[Muslim]]s are being marginalised and [[discrimination|discriminated]] against by ''Fitna''.<ref name="De Arabisch-Europese Liga lanceert film">{{cite news | title = De Arabisch-Europese Liga lanceert film | url = http://belgium.arabeuropean.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=115&Itemid=1 | publisher = Arab European League Belgium | date = 2008-03-28 | accessdate = 2008-03-29 | language = Dutch}}</ref>
On [http://www.ael.nl/ their website], the AEL claimed the following: <blockquote> The announced movie of Wilders and the Danish cartoons are part of an agenda to provoke Muslims in Europe and around the world under the flag of freedom of expression. There can be no doubt about their intentions. Defending their statements with the right of expression is deceptive. There should be a debate on the content. The right-wing movement should not be underestimated. They represent a large part of European society. They are advocating for the eradication of equality as a constitutional law. And more often advocating for constriction of the rights of ethnic minorities. The right-wing movement in the Netherlands and in Europe in general is not compatible with its own "Western values."<ref>AEL Blog about Fitna</ref> </blockquote>
