2013}}</ref>
=== Filming === [[Principal photography]] was confirmed to have begun in [[New York City]], with an original shooting schedule from September 25 to December 5, 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick Has a New Start Date|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-new-start-date/|accessdate=September 25, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=September 25, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick to be shot in New York in October|url=https://twitter.com/Usa_Production|accessdate=September 25, 2013|newspaper=USA Production News|date=September 25, 2013}}</ref> On October 14, 2013, shooting began in [[Mill Neck, New York]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Bridget Moynahan Opposite Keanu Reeves in John Wick|url=https://www.overallsite.com/2013/10/bridget-moynahan-keanu-reeves-john-wick/|accessdate=October 17, 2013|newspaper=Overallsite|date=October 17, 2013}}</ref> with the filming scheduled to continue in the greater New York area.<ref name="ReferenceA" /><ref>{{cite news|title=RUSH CALL: 'John Wick' Starring Keanu Reeves Casting Call for Featured Extra Role in New York City|url=http://www.projectcasting.com/casting-calls-and-auditions/rush-call-john-wick-starring-keanu-reeves-casting-call-for-featured-extra-role-in-new-york-city/|accessdate=November 1, 2013|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=November 1, 2013}}</ref>
On August 26, 2013, Lionsgate announced that they were looking for "a high-end glass house with a water view" that was located in [[Nassau County, New York|Nassau County]] where the 'Intruders' sequence was ultimately filmed. Both interiors and exteriors of the house were used. A couple additional scenes were shot in [[Long Island]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jobs Available, Locations Needed, Casting Notice, Internship/Volunteer Notice|url=http://debramarkowitz.blogspot.co.uk/2013_08_01_archive.html|accessdate=August 26, 2013|newspaper=Debra Markowitz Blogspot|date=August 26, 2013}}</ref> On October 6, 2013, filming occurred next door to the Flatiron School, on 11 Broadway.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick filming near the Flatiron School|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-filming-near-flatiron-school/|accessdate=October 6, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=October 6, 2013}}</ref> The production moved to [[Brooklyn]] on October 24, with filming occurring on [[Sixth Avenue (Manhattan)|6th Avenue]] between Union and [[Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn|Carroll Street]], President Street between 6th and [[Seventh Avenue (Manhattan)|7th Avenues]] and Carroll Street between 6th and 7th Avenues.<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves Thriller 'John Wick' Films In Park Slope Thursday|url=http://parkslopestoop.com/blog/transportation/keanu-reeves-thriller-john-wick-films-in-park-slope-thursday|accessdate=October 23, 2013|newspaper=Park Slope Scoop|date=October 23, 2013}}</ref> Additional filming later occurred at the [[St. Francis Xavier Church (Manhattan)|St. Francis Xavier Church]] on 6th Avenue.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick Filming Russian Mob Scene and Scene Near Church|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-filming-near-church/|accessdate=October 24, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=October 24, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Setting up for Keanu!|url=http://instagram.com/p/f3LzmEgUr0/|accessdate=October 24, 2013|newspaper=Park Slope Scoop|date=October 24, 2013}}</ref> On October 28, 2013, a scene was shot at [[CITGO]] gas station, 501 N. Highland Ave in [[Upper Nyack]], whilst also shooting footage at [[U.S. Route 9W|Route 9W]] and Christian Herald Road.<ref>{{cite news|title=Movie Starring Keanu Reeves Films at Upper Nyack Gas Station|url=http://nyackfreepress.blogspot.co.uk/2013/10/movie-starring-keanu-reeves-films-at.html|accessdate=October 28, 2013|newspaper=Nyack Free Press|date=October 28, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=People Spotting: Keanu Reeves Films at Upper Nyack Gas Station|url=http://www.sloatsburgvillage.com/2013/10/29/people-spotting-keanu-reeves-films-at-upper-nyack-gas-station/|accessdate=October 29, 2013|newspaper=Sloatsburg Village|date=October 29, 2013}}</ref>
On November 1, 2013, filming took place in [[lower Manhattan]] at [[1 Wall Street Court]], used for the exterior of the Continental Hotel. On November 12, 2013, some scenes were shot on 25 Broadway,<ref>{{cite news|title=Tuesday, Nov. 12 Filming Locations for Sleepy Hollow, Blue Bloods, The Good Wife, Eye Candy, Shameless, The Walking Dead, Mad Men, Interstellar, & more!|url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2013/11/12/tuesday-nov-12-filming-locations-for-sleepy-hollow-blue-bloods-the-good-wife-eye-candy-shameless-the-walking-dead-mad-men-interstellar-more/|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=On Location Vacations|date=November 12, 2013}}</ref> and in [[downtown Manhattan]] on Beaver Street by Broad Street.<ref>{{cite news|title=Update on John Wick Shoot Today|url=http://mr-reeves.com/update-john-wick-shoot-today/|accessdate=November 12, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=November 12, 2013}}</ref> Filming also took place at W 43rd Street and [[Eighth Avenue (Manhattan)|8th Avenue]], on November 13, in Manhattan,<ref>{{cite news|title=Wednesday, Nov. 13 Filming Locations for Criminal Minds, Shameless, Eye Candy, The Normal Heart, Franny, Jenny's Wedding & more!|url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2013/11/13/wednesday-nov-13-filming-locations-for-criminal-minds-shameless-eye-candy-the-normal-heart-franny-jennys-wedding-more/|accessdate=November 13, 2013|newspaper=On Location Vacations|date=November 13, 2013}}</ref> and club scenes for ''John Wick'' have been filmed on W 27 Street, with November 15 being the last night schedule at the location.<ref>{{cite news|title=Photos from the John Wick club scene location|url=http://mr-reeves.com/from-john-wick-club-scene-location/|accessdate=November 15, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=November 15, 2013}}</ref> On November 21, 2013, it was announced that a bath house scene was scheduled to be filmed on November 24, December 4 and 5.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – Shooting Dec. 3–5 – Feature Film|url=http://www.nycastings.com/Public_s/v3_ViewNoticeDetail.asp?Qc=Background&Qn=56724|accessdate=November 21, 2013|newspaper=NY Castings|date=November 21, 2013}}</ref> Other shooting locations included [[Tribeca]], on November 20, in which a chase scene was filmed on Church Street.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – Shooting Dec. 3–5 – Feature Film|url=http://www.bondtribeca.com/2013/11/20/keanu-reeves-movie-filming-in-tribeca-today/|accessdate=November 20, 2013|newspaper=Bon Tribeca|date=November 20, 2013}}</ref> It was also reported, on November 27, that filming had been set up on E 83rd and 3rd Street on the [[Upper East Side]].<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick starring Keanu Reeves by my job on 83rd|url=http://instagram.com/p/hOE6WHww5a/|accessdate=November 27, 2013|newspaper=[[Instagram]]|date=November 27, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick shooting on Upper East Side|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-shooting-upper-east-side-today/|accessdate=November 27, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=November 27, 2013}}</ref>
On December 2, 2013, a three-week Upper East Side shoot was scheduled until December 22, with [[Keanu Reeves]] and [[Willem Dafoe]] filming several scenes.<ref>{{cite news|title=New photos of Keanu Reeves filming 'John Wick' in NYC last night|url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2013/12/02/new-photos-of-keanu-reeves-filming-john-wick-in-nyc-last-night/|accessdate=December 2, 2013|newspaper=On Location Vacations|date=December 2, 2013}}</ref> Filming continued to shoot in Tribeca from December 3 to 5, with the notification placed on Church and Franklin.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick continues to shoot in Tribeca|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-continues-shoot-tribeca/|accessdate=December 4, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=December 4, 2013}}</ref> After the Tribeca shoot, the crew moved to Long Island on December 6 to film a funeral scene.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – Feature Film – Shoots Dec 6 |url=http://www.nycastings.com/Public_s/v3_ViewNoticeDetail.asp?Qn=56884&Qc=Background|accessdate=December 6, 2013|newspaper=NY Castings|date=December 6, 2013}}</ref> Additional filming was reported on December 13 for [[Chambers Street (Manhattan)|Chambers Street]], [[Worth Street (IRT Lexington Avenue Line)|Worth Street]] and [[Lafayette Street]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Seen & Heard: China Blue Is Not Quite Ready|url=http://tribecacitizen.com/2013/12/13/seen-heard-china-blue-is-not-quite-ready/|accessdate=December 13, 2013|newspaper=Tribeca Citizen |date=December 13, 2013}}</ref> On December 19, Reeves was filming in the [[Williamsburg, Brooklyn|Williamsburg]] neighborhood of Brooklyn.<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves wields a big gun on John Wick set|url=http://mr-reeves.com/keanu-reeves-wields-big-gun-john-wick-set/|accessdate=December 19, 2013|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=December 19, 2013}}</ref>
Principal photography was confirmed to have ended on December 20, 2013,<ref>{{cite news|title=Last day of principal photography. Sorry for scaring you NYC – Amy Tagliamonti|url=https://twitter.com/amytags/status/414018923957608448/photo/1|accessdate=December 20, 2013|newspaper=[[Twitter]]|date=December 20, 2013}}</ref> with [[post-production]] beginning on January 10, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick Update|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-update/|accessdate=January 23, 2014|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=January 23, 2014}}</ref>
According to directors commentary, their first cut of the movie was 2 hours and 20 minutes long. They didn't reveal much about approximately 39 minutes of footage that was left out of the movie but they did mention that the climactic fight between John and Viggo was pared down after they acknowledged that Viggo shouldn't pose a big physical threat to Wick. David Leitch said many visually amazing shots were cut which were "just Keanu walking in cool environments."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://filmschoolrejects.com/features/38-things-learned-john-wick-commentary.php|title=38 Things we learned from the John Wick commentary|first=Rob|last=Hunter|publisher=Film School Rejects|date=February 2, 2015|accessdate=September 10, 2016}}</ref>
=== Cinematography === {{quote box | quote = Having the ALEXA XT with in-camera ARRIRAW is like going to back to an ARRICAM or an ARRIFLEX 435, which is amazing. |source= — Cinematographer [[Jonathan Sela]], on the usage of ALEXA XT on ''John Wick''<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK">{{cite web|url=http://www.arri.com/news/news/alexa-xt-on-john-wick/|title=ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK|publisher= [[Arri Alexa]]|accessdate=October 24, 2014}}</ref>{{incomprehensible inline|date=April 2018|A quote should illustrate a point in support of the prose but this one would be incomprehensible to the average reader, recommend removing it.}} | align = right | width = 35% }}
The film was shot digitally with [[Arri Alexa]] XT in a [[Aspect ratio (image)|distributed aspect ratio]] of [[2.39:1]].<ref name="John Wick 2014">{{cite web|url=http://shotonwhat.com/john-wick-2014.html|title=John Wick (2014)|publisher= ShotOnWhat|accessdate=October 22, 2014}}</ref> Cinematographer Jonathan Sela chose to work with Arri Alexa XT cameras due to discussions regarding the look of the film. He had pushed for a mix of [[Arricam]] and Alexa for a blend of film and digital<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" /> but the cost of both packages and film was unreasonable so they used ALEXA exclusively. Sela had familiarity with the camera from previous commercial work.<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" />
Sela spoke of the idea that Stahelski, Leitch and himself wished to achieve a visual contrast between John Wick's normal life and the other of which he's drawn back into the underworld of assassins. "We wanted the first look to be soft and clean, and the second to be grittier, darker and sharper." They shot with a single camera so Sela used lenses and camera techniques to achieve the contrasting visuals. He describes the first section of the film as being far more static by stating that, "the camera never stops moving".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arri.com/news/news/alexa-xt-on-john-wick/|title='John Wick' DP Jonathan Sela Achieves Two Distinctive Looks with ARRI Alexa X|publisher= Creative Planet Network|accessdate=October 28, 2014}}</ref> For ''John Wick'' he had decided on using both [[Anamorphic format|anamorphic]] and spherical lenses, to which he combined a set of Hawk V-Lite Vintage '74 anamorphics with that of [[Cooke Optics|Cooke S4]] sphericals. The initial plan was to use the anamorphic and spherical lenses in the first and second parts, respectively, to create the visual contrast; however, he decided against such a course of action as he felt camerawork alone sufficiently separated the worlds, allowing them to use anamorphics for day shoots and sphericals at night.<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" /> Sela praised Hawk's Vintage '74 as "beautiful", though they flare considerably, which would have become overbearing during night-time shooting. He felt their daytime use gave a "hazy look [... which seemed ...] more cinematic".<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" />
According to Sela, on-board ARRIRAW recording with the ALEXA XT cameras made a considerable difference with camerawork, stating, "Having the ALEXA XT with [[In-camera editing|in-camera]] ARRIRAW is like going to back to an ARRICAM or an ARRIFLEX 435, which is amazing."{{incomprehensible inline|date=April 2018|A quote should illustrate a point in support of the prose but this one would be incomprehensible to the average reader, recommend removing it.}} There was a considerable amount of handheld camera work on the second section and usage of the ALEXA M allowed filming through windows and tight spaces, particularly for the car scenes.<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" /> Sela was recording ARRIRAW and used the whole sensor area of ALEXA's 4:3 for the anamorphic scenes, which allowed for the maximisation of the image quality for a 4K cinema release. The extra sensor area provided valuable data for later image processing.<ref name="ALEXA XT on JOHN WICK" />
=== Design === ==== Costume ==== [[Costume designer]] Luca Mosca explained that Wick had to possess a piece of attire that had to be worn throughout almost the entire production of the film. Mosca's team tailored it to be "sleek and timeless" for the film's world. Due to the nature of the world Stahelski and Leitch created, Mosca had to create a statement for every character based on their costume.<ref name="cinemareview.com" /> Reeves gave praise for the costume designer and highlighted Mosca's ability to give the pieces of clothing subtle meanings. He described his costume as "funereal" and "priestly" and stylish without standing out.<ref name="John Wick" /> Initially the villains were to be in combat gear, but later they decided against that due to the principle that they have to be placed in suits, with Leitch quoting Mosca, "It is about men in suits."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cinapse.co/2014/09/30/interview-john-wick-directors-chad-stahelski-and-david-leitch-discuss-capturing-fluid-hard-r-action/|title=INTERVIEW: JOHN WICK DIRECTORS CHAD STAHELSKI AND DAVID LEITCH DISCUSS CAPTURING FLUID, HARD-R ACTION|publisher= [[Cinapse]]|accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref>
==== Set ==== ''John Wick'' features not two worlds, but instead "two of everything", joked production designer Dan Leigh on the contrast of the worlds.<ref name="cinemareview.com" /> Leigh approached the production as a graphic-novel fable, with ethereal textures and unexpected set dressing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://emanuellevy.com/comment/john-wick-visual-style/|title=John Wick: Visual Style|publisher=[[Emanuel Levy]]|accessdate=October 24, 2014}}</ref>
==== Sound ==== James Bolt and Martyn Zub were the [[re-recording mixer]]s. [[Mark Stoeckinger]] was the supervising [[Sound editor (filmmaking)|sound editor]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/movies/movie/477328/John-Wick/credits|title=John Wick (2014) Credits|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=October 24, 2014}}</ref>
[[Production sound mixer]] [[Danny Michael]] had used [[Sound Devices]]' 788T-SSD digital recorder<ref name="sounddevices.com">{{cite web|title=Sound Devices 788T Captures Audio For Veteran Sound Mixer Danny Michael|url=http://www.sounddevices.com/news-events/news/sound-devices-788t-captures-dynamic-audio-for-veteran-sound-mixer-danny-michael|accessdate=May 21, 2014|newspaper=SoundDevices|date=May 21, 2014}}</ref> and CL-WiFi<ref name="sounddevices.com" /> as sound devices, supplemented with a Lectrosonics VRT-Venue System, Lectrosonics radio mics, [[Schoeps]] CMC-6U and CMIT-5U microphones, a Cooper Sound 208 mixer, [[Blackmagic Design|Blackmagic]] dual seven-inch monitors and a Denecke Dcode GR-1 as the main time clock.<ref name="sounddevices.com" /> The action-oriented film required many sound effects and "file-based workflow".<ref name="news.creativecow.net">{{cite web|title=Veteran Sound Mixer Danny Michael Captures Pristine Audio with Sound Devices 788T Digital Recorder|url=https://news.creativecow.net/story/875820|accessdate=May 21, 2014|newspaper=CreativeCOW|date=May 21, 2014}}</ref>{{explain|date=April 2018|What does file-based workflow mean?}}
For Michael, the 788T-SSD's ability to swap removable storage was an advantage, supplying [[CompactFlash]] (CF) to the post-production company Light Iron, in order for them to process the [[dailies|raw unedited footage]] on set.<ref name="news.creativecow.net" /> Michael stated he would hand-off his sound at every camera change to a person in arm's reach<ref name="4rfv.co.uk">{{cite web|title=Sound Mixer Relies On Sound Devices' Digital Recorder For Audio Production|url=http://www.4rfv.co.uk/industrynews/180953/sound_mixer_relies_on_sound_devices_digital_recorder_for_audio_production|accessdate=May 22, 2014|newspaper=4rfv|date=May 22, 2014}}</ref> who assembled it with the digital footage on the spot.<ref name="4rfv.co.uk" />
=== Visual effects === Jake Braver was the overall visual-effects supervisor and visual-effects company Spin VFX worked on most of the visual effects.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spinvfx.com/filmography/|title=Spin VFX – John Wick|publisher=Spin VFX|accessdate=October 24, 2014}}</ref>
== Music == {{Main|John Wick: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack}} The musical score to ''John Wick'' was composed by [[Tyler Bates]] and Joel J. Richard, with on-screen violin music performed by [[Scott Tixier]].<ref name="John Wick' Soundtrack Announced">{{cite web|title='John Wick' Soundtrack Announced|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2014/09/23/john-wick-soundtrack-announced/|accessdate=September 23, 2014|newspaper=Film Music Reporter|date=September 23, 2014}}</ref> The film features a few pieces of additional music such as [[Marilyn Manson (band)|Marilyn Manson]]'s "[[Killing Strangers]]" and T-Bo and Bengie B's "Get Money". The original soundtrack album, ''[[John Wick: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'', was released digitally on October 21, 2014 and received a physical format release on October 27 by [[Varese Sarabande Records]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Varese Sarabande Records To Release 'John Wick' Soundtrack|url=http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=104071|accessdate=October 7, 2014|newspaper=T4C|date=October 7, 2014}}</ref> In addition to Bates and Richard's score, the album features music by artists such as Ciscandra Nostalghia, The Candy Shop Boys, and M86 & Susie Q. [[Le Castle Vania]] provided additional music for the score.<ref name="John Wick' Soundtrack Announced" /><ref>{{cite web|title=Tyler Bates and Ciscandra Nostalghia|url=http://www.zimbio.com/photos/Tyler+Bates/Ciscandra+Nostalghia/John+Wick+Premieres+in+LA/4WKnLBIsnZo|accessdate=October 21, 2014|newspaper=Zimbio|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref>
== Influences == Director Chad Stahelski said influences on ''John Wick'' included ''[[The Good, the Bad and the Ugly]]'' (1966), ''[[Point Blank (1967 film)|Point Blank]]'' (1967), ''[[Le Cercle Rouge]]'' (1970), and ''[[The Killer (1989 film)|The Killer]]'' (1989).<ref name="ScreenRant">{{cite web|title='John Wick' Directors Talk World-Building & Not Killing a Dog in the Sequel|url=http://screenrant.com/john-wick-directors-interview-sequel-ending-spoilers/|work=ScreenRant|accessdate=October 26, 2014}}</ref>
Stahelski considered the untold backstory in ''The Good, the Bad and the Ugly'' and wanted to leave John Wick's to the audience's imagination.<ref name="Grantland" /> He also said that they repeatedly watched ''Point Blank'' and made homages to it in ''John Wick''.<ref name="Complex">{{cite web|url=http://uk.complex.com/pop-culture/2014/10/interview-john-wick-keanu-reeves/page/2|title=Keanu Reeves Came Up With a Badass Hashtag for "John Wick"|publisher=Complex|accessdate=October 24, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129090256/http://uk.complex.com/pop-culture/2014/10/interview-john-wick-keanu-reeves/page/2|archivedate=November 29, 2014|df=}}</ref> [[Park Chan-wook]]'s ''[[The Vengeance Trilogy]]'' (2002–2005) and [[Lee Jeong-beom]]'s ''[[The Man from Nowhere (film)|The Man from Nowhere]]'' (2010) influenced the film due to their "minimalist composition and graphic nature."<ref>{{cite web|title=Chad Stahelski & David Leitch, longtime stunt coordinators & performers, founders of 87Eleven Action Design, and the filmmakers responsible for the new Keanu Reeves action-thriller 'JOHN WICK' ... Ask us anything!|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/movies/comments/2hwln0/hi_rmovies_were_chad_stahelski_david_leitch/|work=[[Reddit]]|accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref>
Screenwriter Derek Kolstad said that he was hugely influenced by [[Alistair MacLean]] for world-building and [[Stephen King]] for characterisation, noting that King surprised readers with what a protagonist could be driven to.<ref>{{cite web|title=An interview with Derek Kolstad, screenwriter of John Wick|url=http://www.flickeringmyth.com/2014/10/interview-derek-kolstad-screenwriter-john-wick.html|work=Flickering Myth|accessdate=October 24, 2014}}</ref> Stahelski and Leitch also drew inspiration from the visual stylings of the 1960s and 1970s and works of [[Sergio Leone]], [[Akira Kurosawa]], [[Steve McQueen]], [[Lee Marvin]], [[William Friedkin]] and [[Sam Peckinpah]].<ref name="Grantland" /> Stahelski stated liking the Kurosawa and [[spaghetti western]] sensibility in the composition, and that [[noir film]] had less influence on them.<ref name="ScreenRant" /><ref name="Complex" /><ref>{{cite web|title='John Wick' Directors Talk World-Building & Not Killing a Dog in the Sequel|url=http://pixmovies.co.uk/news/342-john-wick-directors-talk-worldbuilding-not-killing-a-dog-in-the-sequel|work=PixMovies|accessdate=October 25, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129033725/http://pixmovies.co.uk/news/342-john-wick-directors-talk-worldbuilding-not-killing-a-dog-in-the-sequel|archivedate=November 29, 2014|df=}}</ref>
== Marketing == The official website for ''John Wick'' debuted on August 15, 2014 introducing a marketing campaign and interactive layout to promote the film. The website streamed an audio file and contained interactive games such as "The Red Circle Club" and "Revenge Ride".<ref>{{cite web|title=Domaintools – John Wick the Movie|url=http://whois.domaintools.com/johnwickthemovie.com|accessdate=August 15, 2014|newspaper=DomainTools.com|date=August 15, 2014}}</ref> Lionsgate provided information on the cast and crew along with a gallery and video section.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick the Movie – Official Website|url=http://www.johnwickthemovie.com/|accessdate=August 15, 2014|newspaper=John Wick|date=August 15, 2014}}</ref> The first images debuted on August 21, 2014 featuring Reeves' as Wick.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves is a former assassin for the first images of the action JOHN WICK, with Willem Dafoe|url=http://www.loucosporfilmes.net/2014/08/keanu-reeves-imagens-john-wick.html#.VGxbAzSsXQV|accessdate=August 22, 2014 |publisher=[[JoBlo.com]]|date=August 22, 2014}}</ref> With the release Liongate confirmed the film being set for a "sudden release" on October 24, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=The first image of Keanu Reeves as ex-hitman John Wick|url=http://www.joblo.com/movie-news/the-first-image-of-keanu-reeves-as-ex-hitman-john-wick-600|accessdate=August 22, 2014 |publisher=[[JoBlo.com]]|date=August 22, 2014}}</ref> On September 10, 2014, the teaser poster was released with the confirmation date of the expected teaser trailer.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves is About to Explode on a Teaser Poster for 'John Wick'|url=http://www.firstshowing.net/2014/keanu-reeves-is-about-to-explode-on-a-teaser-poster-for-john-wick/|accessdate=September 10, 2014 |publisher=[[JoBlo.com]] |date=September 10, 2014}}</ref> The teaser trailer for ''John Wick'' debuted September 12, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|title=EXCLUSIVE TRAILER FOR KEANU REEVES' ASSASSIN FILM JOHN WICK TO DEBUT THIS WEEK|url=http://uk.ign.com/articles/2014/09/09/exclusive-trailer-for-keanu-reeves-assassin-film-john-wick-to-debut-this-week|accessdate=September 12, 2014|publisher=[[IGN]]|date=September 12, 2014}}</ref> The [[theatrical release]] poster and the final theatrical trailer were both released on September 30, 2014, by Stahelski and Leitch on an 'Ask me anything' [[Reddit]] session.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves is back in the badass final poster and trailer for John Wick|url=http://www.joblo.com/movie-news/keanu-reeves-is-back-in-the-badass-final-poster-and-trailer-for-john-wick-569|accessdate=September 30, 2014 |publisher=[[JoBlo.com]] |date=September 30, 2014}}</ref>
[[Lionsgate]] had provided [[Collider (website)|Collider]] and [[Moviepilot]], on October 2, 2014, with a prize pack to give away to various readers, which included ''[[Assassin's Creed Unity]]'', a $25 [[Fandango (ticket service)|Fandango]] gift card, a Lionsgate DVD 3-pack with ''[[Dredd]]'', ''[[Gamer (2009 film)|Gamer]]'', and ''[[First Blood|Rambo]]'', and a John Wick poster and T-shirt.<ref>{{cite web|title=Enter Our JOHN WICK Giveaway and Win Free Stuff|url=http://collider.com/john-wick-giveaway/|accessdate=October 2, 2014 |newspaper=[[Collider (website)|Collider]] |date=October 2, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Win Assassin's Creed, a John Wick T-Shirt & Poster, and Free Movie Tickets!|url=http://moviepilot.com/posts/2014/10/02/win-assassin-s-creed-a-john-wick-t-shirt-poster-and-free-movie-tickets-2306437?lt_source=external,manual,share_twitter,manual,manual|accessdate=October 2, 2014|publisher=[[Moviepilot]] |date=October 2, 2014}}</ref> On October 6, 2014, the official website for ''John Wick'' had been updated to include three trailers, photographs with John's story, individual cast photos, and mini-biographies.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick Site Updated – Update|url=http://mr-reeves.com/john-wick-site-updated/|accessdate=October 7, 2014|newspaper=Mr-Reeves|date=October 7, 2014}}</ref> The [[IMAX]] TV spot trailer for ''John Wick'' debuted October 6, 2014, featuring new footage of the film.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick IMAX® TV Spot|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkiegCvcyjU|accessdate=October 6, 2014|publisher=[[IMAX]]|date=October 6, 2014}}</ref> Carl F. Bucherer was the official partner of the ''John Wick'' premiere in New York City on October 13, 2014. [[Keanu Reeves]] sported a Manero AutoDate with a light dial, [[Willem Dafoe]] wore a Manero AutoDate in classic black, and [[Daniel Bernhardt]] with a Patravi ChronoGrade.<ref>{{cite web|title='John Wick' movie premiere |url=http://www.carl-f-bucherer.com/en/news/%E2%80%98john-wick%E2%80%99-movie-premiere|accessdate=October 14, 2014 |publisher=[[Carl F. Bucherer]] |date=October 14, 2014}}</ref> An IMAX featurette was released on October 22, 2014 with clips relating to the film accompanied by statements by Reeves, Stahelski, and Leitch.<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick IMAX® Featurette|url=http://www.carl-f-bucherer.com/en/news/detail/filmpremiere-john-wick/|accessdate=October 14, 2014 |publisher=[[Carl F. Bucherer]]|date=October 14, 2014}}</ref>
On October 16, 2014, ''John Wick'' was featured on the week's issue of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu's Stuntman Becomes His Boss|url=http://m.ew.com/2014/10/17/keanus-stuntman-becomes-his-boss/|accessdate=October 17, 2014|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=October 17, 2014}}</ref>
As part of a cross-promotional deal with [[Overkill Software]], Lionsgate and Thunder Road Pictures, on October 21, 2014, John Wick was added as a playable character in the online game ''[[Payday 2]]''. Other elements from the film were included, such as Wick's signature weapons and skill tree that allowed for dual-wielding of certain firearms.<ref>{{cite web|title=Overkill Software And Lionsgate Team Up For Free John Wick Payday 2 DLC|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2014/10/21/overkill-software-and-lionsgate-team-up-for-free-john-wick-payday-2-dlc.aspx|accessdate=October 21, 2014|newspaper=[[Game Informer]]|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref> Fandango offered people who purchased tickets online at select theaters a free download of ''Payday 2'' through [[Steam (software)|Steam]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Fandango: Buy John Wick ticket get free Payday 2|url=http://www.steamgifts.com/forum/Swepo/fandango-buy-john-wick-ticket-get-free-payday-2|accessdate=October 21, 2014|publisher=[[Steam (software)|Steam]]|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref> ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' described Liongate's deal as a "pretty imaginative marketing move".<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves' 'John Wick' Becomes Playable Character in 'Payday 2′ Video Game|url=https://variety.com/2014/digital/games/keanu-reeves-john-wick-becomes-playable-character-in-payday-2-video-game-1201335958/|accessdate=October 21, 2014|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref> Danielle DePalma, Lionsgate's EVP of digital marketing, stated, "We're big fans of ''Payday 2'' and the team at Starbreeze, and we're thrilled to kick off our partnership with such a cool movie".<ref name="ReferenceB">{{cite web|title=Play Hitman John Wick in Online Game 'Payday 2'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/play-hitman-john-wick-online-742538|accessdate=October 21, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref> Bo Andersson Klint, [[Starbreeze Studios|Starbreeze]] CEO, stated, "We've finally got a real hitman on our team. Being able to play as John Wick in ''Payday 2'' ahead of the movie's release is a great reward for our loyal ''Payday 2'' community."<ref name="ReferenceB" />{{relevance inline|date=April 2018|These last two statements seem like fluff; a marketing executive saying what a great marketing partnership it is? Recommend deleting this self-promotion.}}
== Release == [[File:ArcLightandDome.jpg|left|thumbnail|right|The [[ArcLight Hollywood]] in Hollywood, California hosted the film's [[Los Angeles]] premiere.]] ''John Wick'' [[Film premiere|premiered]] at the Regal Union Square Theatre, Stadium 14 on October 13, 2014 in [[New York City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Stars and cast arrive for New York premiere of 'John Wick'|url=http://www.demotix.com/news/6003688/stars-and-cast-arrive-new-york-premiere-john-wick#media-6003684|accessdate=October 12, 2014|newspaper=Demotix|date=October 12, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150102042456/http://www.demotix.com/news/6003688/stars-and-cast-arrive-new-york-premiere-john-wick#media-6003684|archivedate=January 2, 2015|df=}}</ref> It had an earlier screening at the [[Austin Fantastic Fest]] on September 19,<ref>{{cite news|title=Fantastic Fest Adds Keanu Reeves' 'John Wick'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/fantastic-fest-adds-keanu-reeves-728481|accessdate=August 27, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=August 27, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – Fantastic Fest|url=http://fantasticfest.com/films/john-wick|accessdate=September 19, 2014|newspaper=[[Fantastic Fest]]|date=September 19, 2014}}</ref> where it opened the official sidebar section, Special Gala Screening, to an astounding reception.<ref>{{cite news|title='John Wick' Fantastic Fest Poster Featuring Keanu Reeves|url=http://www.movieweb.com/john-wick-movie-poster-fantastic-fest|accessdate=September 20, 2014|newspaper=Movie Web|date=September 20, 2014}}</ref> It opened in [[Los Angeles]] at the [[ArcLight Hollywood]] on October 22, 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves, Adrianne Palicki on 'John Wick,' Dogs and Stunts|url=https://variety.com/2014/scene/news/keanu-reeves-john-wick-adrianne-palicki-dogs-and-stunts-1201337425/|accessdate=October 23, 2014|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref> ''John Wick'' had its television premiere on the USA channel on March 12, 2017.
=== Pre-release screenings === Prior to ''John Wick'''s public release, an advance screening of the film was shown on October 9, 2014 at Regal Oakwood in [[Hollywood, Florida]].<ref>{{cite news|title=MIAMI: WIN PASSES TO AN ADVANCE SCREENING OF 'JOHN WICK'!|url=http://fandomsnation.com/2014/10/01/miami-win-passes-to-an-advance-screening-of-john-wick/|accessdate=October 1, 2014|newspaper=Fandoms Nation|date=October 1, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006160542/http://fandomsnation.com/2014/10/01/miami-win-passes-to-an-advance-screening-of-john-wick/|archivedate=October 6, 2014|df=}}</ref> A screening was shown in advance at the UA Court Street in [[Brooklyn, New York]] on October 14.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick Advance Screening|url=http://www.giantstep.net/index.php/events/2193/|accessdate=September 24, 2014|newspaper=Giant Step|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref> Glendale Designs sponsored a private screening on October 16, 2014 at Harkins Arrowhead in [[Peoria, Arizona]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Lionsgate Early Screening|url=https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=647197188724641|accessdate=October 2, 2014|newspaper=[[Facebook]]|date=October 2, 2014}}</ref> BackstageOL and Lionsgate hosted an advance screening on October 21, 2014 at Edwards Greenway Grand Palace Stadium in [[Houston, Texas]] and at the Santikos Embassy 14 in [[San Antonio, Texas]]. Additionally, Lionsgate had announced 40 additional advanced screenings at selected theatres in the [[United States]] October 21 and 22, as part of a national promotional campaign.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick ComingSoon – National Campaign|url=https://www.lionsgatescreenings.com/index.php/main/national_campaign/JohnWickComingSoon|accessdate=October 21, 2014|newspaper=[[Lionsgate]]|date=October 21, 2014}}</ref> [[Entertainment One Films]] held advance screenings in [[Toronto]], [[Ottawa]], [[Halifax, Nova Scotia|Halifax]], [[Calgary]], [[Edmonton]], [[Victoria, British Columbia|Victoria]] and [[Vancouver]] between October 20 and 23.<ref>{{cite news|title=Contest: See John Wick!|url=http://dorkshelf.com/2014/09/25/contest-see-john-wick/|accessdate=September 25, 2014|newspaper=Dork Shelf|date=September 25, 2014}}</ref>
=== Theatrical run === ''John Wick'' began a wide theatrical release in the [[United States]] on October 24, 2014,<ref>{{cite news|title=Is IMAX/Netflix Deal An "Et Tu, Brute?" Moment?|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2014/10/03/is-imaxnetflix-deal-an-et-tu-brute-moment/|accessdate=October 3, 2014|newspaper=[[Forbes]]|date=October 3, 2014}}</ref> expanding in successive weeks to [[France]], [[Australia]] and [[Netherlands]],<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – Australia|url=https://twitter.com/Company_Films/status/505349591311876096|accessdate=August 29, 2014|newspaper=Roadshow Films|date=August 29, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – France|url=http://www.allocine.fr/film/fichefilm_gen_cfilm=221387.html|accessdate=October 20, 2014|newspaper=Allocine|date=October 20, 2014}}</ref> and premiered in the [[United Kingdom]] on February 2, 2015 after expanding throughout Europe.<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves Talks Training For Thrilling 'John Wick' Flick|url=http://www.moviecricket.com/keanu-reeves-talks-training-thrilling-john-wick-flick-22947/|accessdate=October 20, 2014|newspaper=Movie Cricket|date=October 20, 2014}}</ref><ref name="prnewswire.com">{{cite news|title=LIONSGATE ACHIEVES RECORD SALES AT 2013 CANNES MARKET WITH SLATE OF NINE FILMS LED BY MOCKINGJAY 1 & 2, STEP UP 5 AND THE LAST WITCH HUNTER|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/lionsgate-achieves-record-sales-at-2013-cannes-market-with-slate-of-nine-films-led-by-mockingjay-1--2-step-up-5-and-the-last-witch-hunter-208446701.html|accessdate=May 22, 2013|newspaper=[[PR Newswire]]|date=May 22, 2013}}</ref>
On May 22, 2013, Liongate had sold more than $250 million in territorial rights to nine titles at the Cannes Film Festival, including ''John Wick''.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lionsgate Touts Cannes Sales of Over $250 Million|url=https://variety.com/2013/more/news/lionsgate-touts-cannes-sales-of-over-250-million-1200486137/|accessdate=May 22, 2013|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=May 22, 2013}}</ref> [[Studio Canal]] will distribute the piece throughout [[Germany]],<ref name="lionsgatepublicity.com">{{cite news|title=LIONSGATE ACHIEVES RECORD SALES AT 2013 CANNES MARKET WITH SLATE OF NINE FILMS LED BY MOCKINGJAY 1 & 2, STEP UP 5 AND THE LAST WITCH HUNTER|url=http://lionsgatepublicity.com/press-release/1522|accessdate=May 22, 2013|newspaper=[[Lionsgate]]|date=May 22, 2013}}</ref> [[Metropolitan Filmexport]] acquired the [[France|French]] distribution rights to ''John Wick'' from Lionsgate,<ref>{{cite news|title=France's Metropolitan Stocks|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/news/frances-metropolitan-stocks-up-on-u-s-indie-fare-1200491318/|accessdate=June 3, 2013|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=June 3, 2013}}</ref> Acme Film acquired the distribution rights throughout the [[Baltic region]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Pet's Slaughter Uncorks a Latent Inner Assassin|author=Catsoulis, Jeannette|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/movies/movie/477328/John-Wick/credits|accessdate=October 24, 2014|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref> Monolith Films acquired the film rights in [[Poland]], [[Imagem]] had acquired the [[Latin American]] distribution rights,<ref name="lionsgatepublicity.com" /> [[Orange Sky Golden Harvest]] obtained the film rights in [[Taiwan]] and [[Hong Kong]],<ref name="prnewswire.com" /> and Media Pro acquired the rights in the regions of [[Czech Republic|Czech]], [[Romania]], [[Hungary]], and [[Bulgaria]].<ref name="prnewswire.com" /> [[Entertainment One Films]] picked up the Canadian distribution rights.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick|url=http://ca.eonefilms.com/films/john-wick|accessdate=October 3, 2014|newspaper=[[Entertainment One Films]]|date=October 3, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141129041841/http://ca.eonefilms.com/films/john-wick|archivedate=November 29, 2014|df=}}</ref> On June 10, 2014, Belga Films had acquired the rights to distribute the film within the [[Benelux]] region.<ref>{{cite news|title=Belgium's Belga Films Inks Output Deal With 'Grace of Monaco' Producer Umedia|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/belgiums-belga-films-inks-output-710731|accessdate=June 10, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=June 10, 2014}}</ref> On July 2, 2014, MK2 Pictures were confirmed to have acquired the [[Italy|Italian]] distribution rights to ''John Wick''.<ref name="lionsgatepublicity.com" /><ref>{{cite news|title=Cinema: Riccione, listino M2 dall'horror al romance con un film per tutti|url=http://www.arezzoweb.it/2014/cinema-riccione-listino-m2-dallhorror-al-romance-con-un-film-per-tutti-217680.html|accessdate=July 2, 2014|newspaper=Areezzo Web|date=July 2, 2014}}</ref> On May 8, 2014, the [[Huayi Brothers]] picked up the [[China|Chinese]] distribution rights to ''John Wick'', being one of only four films from the United States that were picked up, with a planned 2015 limited theatrical release.<ref>{{cite news|title=China's Huayi Opens International Chapter, Confirms Studio 8 Investment Plans|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/chinas-huayi-opens-international-chapter-confirms-media-8-investment-plans-1201175477/|accessdate=May 8, 2014|newspaper=[[Variety planned 2014 limited theatrical release,<ref>{{cite news|title=Lionsgate picks up action thriller John Wick|url=http://www.screendaily.com/news/distribution/lionsgate-acquires-john-wick/5076132.article?referrer=RSS|accessdate=August 11, 2014|newspaper=[[Screen International]]|date=August 11, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lionsgate picks up action thriller John Wick|url=http://article.wn.com/view/2014/08/11/Lionsgate_picks_up_action_thriller_John_Wick/|accessdate=August 11, 2014|newspaper=[[World News Network]]|date=August 11, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Lionsgate Publicity|url=http://www.lionsgatepublicity.com/|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=[[Lions Gate Entertainment]]|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> and in October, [[Summit Entertainment]], a Lionsgate company, distributed the film in the United States<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves Hitman Starrer 'John Wick' Added to October Release Slate|url=http://www.ropeofsilicon.com/keanu-reeves-hitman-starrer-john-wick-added-october-release-slate/|accessdate=August 14, 2014|newspaper=Rope of Silicon|date=August 14, 2014}}</ref> On October 31, 2014, it was announced that [[Warner Bros. Pictures]] would be distributing the film within the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick – British Board of Film Classification|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/john-wick-film|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=[[British Board of Film Classification]]|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=John Wick UK Release Date Pushed to April 2015|url=http://www.finalreel.co.uk/john-wick-uk-release-date/|accessdate=October 31, 2014|newspaper=Rope of Silicon|date=October 31, 2014}}</ref> It was later announced that the release date in the United Kingdom was moved back from the first weekend of 2015 to April 10, 2015.<ref name="finalreel.co.uk">{{cite news|title=John Wick UK Release Date Pushed to April 2015|url=http://www.finalreel.co.uk/john-wick-uk-release-date-2015/|accessdate=January 4, 2015|newspaper=Final Reel|date=January 4, 2015}}</ref>
On October 2, 2014, Summit Entertainment announced that ''John Wick'' would be released in [[IMAX]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Keanu Reeves' 'John Wick' to Get Imax Release|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/keanu-reeves-john-wick-get-737550|accessdate=October 2, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 2, 2014}}</ref> Phil Groves, Senior Vice President of IMAX Corp and Executive Vice President of Global Distribution, IMAX Entertainment, stated, "''John Wick'' is a fun action romp, complete with a tremendously entertaining performance by Keanu Reeves that is perfect for IMAX fans."<ref>{{cite news|title=Summit Entertainment's John Wick To Bust Into IMAX® Theatres Domestically On Oct. 24|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/102052953#|accessdate=October 2, 2014|newspaper=[[CNBC]]|date=October 2, 2014}}</ref> further adding, "There's no better place for audiences to experience the film's stylized storytelling than in IMAX theatres."<ref>{{cite news|title=Summit Entertainment's John Wick To Bust Into IMAX® Theatres Domestically On Oct. 24|url=http://money.cnn.com/news/newsfeeds/articles/prnewswire/NY27966.htm|accessdate=October 2, 2014|newspaper=[[CNN]]|date=October 2, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141005102656/http://money.cnn.com/news/newsfeeds/articles/prnewswire/NY27966.htm|archivedate=October 5, 2014|df=}}</ref>{{relevance inline|date=April 2018|Self-promotional: this is an IMAX executive saying what a great IMAX film it is.}}
=== Box office === ''John Wick'' earned $14.4 million from 2,589 locations on its opening weekend,<ref name="forbes"/> compared to the $7–8 million most analysts projected the film would make.<ref>{{cite web|title=Box Office: 'Ouija' Tops Charts, 'John Wick' Surprises|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/box-office-ouija-tops-charts-john-wick-surprises-1201339493/ |author= Lang, Brent |accessdate=October 26, 2014|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=October 26, 2014}}</ref> By the end of its theatrical run, ''John Wick'' grossed $45.7 million in North America and $43 million in other territories for a worldwide total of $88.7 million, against a production budget of $20 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=johnwick.htm|title=John Wick (2014)|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]|accessdate=January 12, 2015}}</ref>
The film had a wide release in the United States and Canada in selected theatres on October 24.<ref>{{cite web|title=Oct 24, 2014 Now In-Theater: October 24, 2014: JOHN WICK, OUIJA, LAGGIES|url=http://film-book.com/now-in-theater-october-24-2014-john-wick-ouija-laggies/|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=Film Book|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> The film earned $5.45 million on its opening day,<ref>{{cite web|title=Friday Report: 'Ouija' Haunts Top Spot with $8.3 Million|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3942&p=.htm|accessdate=October 25, 2014|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |date=October 25, 2014}}</ref> including $875,000 from Thursday night previews,<ref>{{cite web|title='Ouija' Box Office Starts With $911K, 'John Wick' $870K – B.O. Late Nights|url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/ouija-box-office-results-john-wick-st-vincent-859492/|accessdate=October 24, 2014|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> which was the second-highest opening of that weekend, at an average of $5,465 per theater.<ref>{{cite web|title=Weekend Box Office: Ouija conjures up dead presidents|url=http://www.avclub.com/article/weekend-box-office-ouija-conjures-dead-presidents-211005 |author=Rife, Katie |accessdate=October 27, 2014|newspaper=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=October 27, 2014}}</ref> The film grossed $2.5 million from 347 [[IMAX]] locations that weekend, which represented 17.7 percent of the film's overall gross for its opening weekend.<ref>{{cite web|title='Ouija' Scares Up $20.0M To Lead Weekend; 'John Wick' Takes Second With Solid $14.15M; 'St. Vincent' #6 With An Encouraging $8.06M|url=http://pro.boxoffice.com/north-america-studio-estimates-ouija-scares-up-20-0m-to-lead-weekend-john-wick-takes-second-with-solid-14-15m-st-vincent-6-with-an-encouraging-8-06m/|accessdate=October 26, 2014|newspaper=Box Office|date=October 26, 2014}}</ref> The audience was 60% male and 77% were older than 25.<ref>{{cite web|title=''Ouija'' scares up $20 million in opening weekend; 'John Wick' No. 2|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-box-office-ouija-john-wick-fury-st-vincent-20141026-story.html |author= Hamedy, Saba |accessdate=October 26, 2014|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=October 26, 2014}}</ref><ref name="forbes">{{cite web|title=Box Office: ''Ouija'' Summons $20M Weekend, Keanu Reeves' 'John Wick' Nabs $14M|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2014/10/26/box-office-ouija-summons-20m-weekend-keanu-reeves-john-wick-opens-to-14m/ |author=Mendelson, Scott |accessdate=October 26, 2014 |newspaper=[[Forbes]]|date=October 26, 2014}}</ref>
Outside North America, the film took $1.4 million during its international opening weekend.<ref name="boxofficemojo.com">{{cite web|title=John Wick|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=johnwick.htm|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=Box Office Mojo|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> The film's highest-grossing debuts were in [[France]], [[Australia]], [[Thailand]], [[Mexico]], and the [[United Arab Emirates]].<ref name="boxofficemojo.com" /> On its second week, it added $6.7 million from 33 territories.<ref name="deadline.com">{{cite web|title='Turtles', 'Maze Runner' Top Int'l Box Office Ahead Of 'Interstellar' Start: FINAL|url=http://deadline.com/2014/11/international-box-office-guardians-of-the-galaxy-number-2-movie-2014-turtles-china-maze-runner-kung-fu-jungle-happy-new-year-1201271064/ |author= Tartaglione, Nancy |accessdate=November 3, 2014|publisher=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=November 3, 2014}}</ref> The film went number one in France ($1.2 million) from 300 screens, number three in Australia ($961,000) from 177 screens, and number ten in the [[Middle East]] ($1 million) from a total of 80 screens.<ref name="deadline.com" />
== Reception == ''John Wick'' enjoyed a mostly positive reception upon release, attaining praise for the action sequences, direction, visual style, pacing and the performances of the cast, especially Keanu Reeves as John Wick.<ref name="reception">{{cite news|last1=Gettell|first1=Oliver|title=Keanu Reeves is on fire in 'John Wick,' reviews say|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-john-wick-keanu-reeves-movie-reviews-critics-20141023-story.html|accessdate=April 4, 2018|work=Los Angeles Times|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> The review aggregation website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gave the film a score of 86% based on 202 reviews, and an [[average rating]] of 7.2/10. Its critical consensus reads, "Stylish, thrilling, and giddily kinetic, ''John Wick'' serves as a satisfying return to action for Keanu Reeves – and what looks like it could be the first of a franchise."<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick (2014)|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/john_wick/|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|accessdate=April 4, 2018}}</ref> [[Metacritic]], another review aggregator, assigned the film a weighted average score of 68 out of 100, based on 40 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick Reviews|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/john-wick|publisher=[[Metacritic]]|accessdate=December 18, 2014}}</ref> [[CinemaScore]] reported that audiences gave the film a "B" grade, on an A+ to F scale.<ref>{{cite web|title=CinemaScore – John Wick|url=http://www.cinemascore.com/|work=[[CinemaScore]]|accessdate=October 27, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title='Ouija' Says Yes To No. 1, 'John Wick' No. 2 With A Bullet, 'St. Vincent,' Superb Exit Polls – B.O. Weekend|url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/box-office-ouija-john-wick-st-vincent-859761/|work=Deadline|accessdate=October 26, 2014}}</ref>
[[Peter Travers]] of ''[[Rolling Stone (magazine)|Rolling Stone]]'' stated, "''John Wick'' is the kind of fired-up, ferocious B-movie fun some of us can't get enough of" and noted the "juicy performances" from Dafoe, Leguizamo, and McShane.<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves goes ballistic in this bloody bit of B-movie fun|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/john-wick-20141024#ixzz3H5Q8mIpu|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=[[Rolling Stone (magazine)|Rolling Stone]]|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> [[Richard Corliss]] of ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine wrote, "Action movies are about movement, and ''John Wick'' pursues that goal with remorseless verve."<ref>{{cite web|title=Review: In John Wick, Keanu Reeves is Back Up to Speed|url=http://time.com/3536452/keanu-reeves-john-wick-review/|accessdate=October 24, 2014|newspaper=[[TIME Magazine]]|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> [[Ignatiy Vishnevetsky]] of ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' gave the film an "B+" rating, stating, "An underworld fantasy that grafts crisp action on to [[Rian Johnson]]-esque world-building, producing one of the more fully realized shoot-'em-up flicks in recent memory." He continued by praising Kolstad's script which "distinguishes itself by carefully defining the boundaries of its universe".<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves shoots his way through the entertaining action fantasy John Wick|url=http://www.avclub.com/review/keanu-reeves-shoots-his-way-through-entertaining-a-210627|accessdate=October 23, 2014|newspaper=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref> Chris Nashawaty of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave the film an "A−" rating and called Kolstad's screenplay, "a marvelously rich and stylish feat of pulpy world-building."<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20865430,00.html|accessdate=October 22, 2014|newspaper=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|date=October 22, 2014}}</ref>
Justin Lowe of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' wrote, "After a marked absence from the genre, Reeves resoundingly returns with an effortless, kinetic style that positions the film extremely well for any potential follow-ups."<ref>{{cite web|title='John Wick': Film Review|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/john-wick/review/742842|accessdate=October 22, 2014|newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 22, 2014}}</ref> Peter Debruge of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' spoke highly of the film, "Back in action-hero mode, Keanu Reeves joins forces with his ''[[The Matrix (franchise)|Matrix]]'' stunt double to deliver a slick and satisfying revenge thriller" and noted "what a thrill well-choreographed action can be when we're actually able to make out what's happening".<ref>{{cite web|title=Film Review: 'John Wick'|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/reviews/film-review-keanu-reeves-in-john-wick-1201331660/|accessdate=October 16, 2014|newspaper=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=October 16, 2014}}</ref> [[Stephanie Zacharek]] of ''[[The Village Voice]]'' said that, "Reeves is wonderful here, a marvel of physicality and stern determination – he moves with the grace of an old-school swashbuckler."<ref>{{cite web|title=Keanu Reeves Is Just Plain Awesome in John Wick|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2014-10-22/film/john-wick/|accessdate=October 22, 2014|newspaper=[[The Village Voice]]|date=October 22, 2014}}</ref> [[Bilge Ebiri]] of ''[[Vulture (blog)|Vulture]]'' commented, "It's a beautiful coffee-table action movie."<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick Is a Violent, Violent, Violent Film, But Oh-So Beautiful|url=http://www.vulture.com/2014/10/john-wick-movie-review.html|accessdate=October 23, 2014|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref>
Jeannette Catsoulis wrote, in her review for ''[[The New York Times]]'', "Harboring few ambitions beyond knock-your-socks-off action sequences, this crafty revenge thriller delivers with so much style – and even some wit – that the lack of substance takes longer than it should to become problematic." Catsoulis praised Dafoe and Leguizamo for "bringing real subtlety to an all-too-brief scene" and Nyqvist as "marvellous", as well as Stahelski's direction and Sela's cinematography.<ref>{{cite web|title=Pet's Slaughter Uncorks a Latent Inner Assassin|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/24/movies/in-john-wick-keanu-reeves-as-an-avenger.html?partner=rss&emc=rss|accessdate=October 23, 2014|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref> Forrest Wickman of ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]'' noted, "''John Wick'' offers a slow burn, sizzling in a manner true to its hero's surname."<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick|url=http://www.slate.com/articles/arts/culturebox/2014/10/keanu_reeves_action_movie_john_wick_reviewed.html|accessdate=February 11, 2015|newspaper=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]|date=October 24, 2014}}</ref> [[Jordan Hoffman]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' scored the film four out of five stars, writing, "A slick, propulsive and ridiculous crime picture that strides like an automatic machine gun."<ref>{{cite web|title=John Wick review – a thrill ride driven by a relentless vengeance machine|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/oct/23/john-wick-review-thrill-ride-relentless-vengeance-machine|accessdate=October 23, 2014|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref>
However, [[Peter Bradshaw]], also reviewing for ''The Guardian'', gave the film 2 out of 5 stars and stated "Reeves's semi-deliberate zonked deadpan style only really works in juxtaposition with funny dialogue – and this is a pretty humourless and violent film, which grinds on and on with more and more gleaming black SUVs getting trashed."<ref>{{cite web|title=Pet's Slaughter Uncorks a Latent Inner Assassin|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/apr/09/john-wick-review-keanu-reeves-in-humourless-violent-generic-action-film|accessdate=October 23, 2014|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=October 23, 2014}}</ref> Ealasaid Haas of ''[[San Jose Mercury News]]'' described ''John Wick'' as a "disappointingly standard revenge movie."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mercurynews.com/milpitas/ci_26830372/review-john-wick-is-disappointingly-standard-revenge-movie|title=Review: 'John Wick' is a disappointingly standard revenge movie|last=Haas|first=Ealasaid A.|date=October 30, 2014|work=[[San Jose Mercury News]]|accessdate=January 2, 2016}}</ref> John Semley of ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' called the title "the new name in crummy action cinema," giving it one-half out of 4 stars.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/arts/film/film-reviews/john-wick-the-new-name-in-crummy-action-cinema/article21273677/|title=John Wick: the new name in crummy action cinema|last=Semley|first=John|date=October 24, 2014|work=[[The Globe and Mail]]|publisher=Phillip Crawley|accessdate=January 2, 2016|location=Toronto}}</ref>
== Video game == On August 7, 2015, Lionsgate and [[Starbreeze Studios]] announced a partnership to develop a first-person shooter [[Virtual Reality|virtual reality]] game based on the film for the [[HTC Vive]]/[[Steam VR]]. Development was to be headed by Grab Games, with Starbreeze set to publish. WEVR was to develop an introductory experience for the game. The game was released on February 9, 2017, with the name ''John Wick Chronicles''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/382360/|title=John Wick Chronicles|publisher=}}</ref> and have a standalone narrative based on the Continental Hotel.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avclub.com/article/john-wick-being-turned-vr-game-hopefully-sans-pupp-223547 |title=John Wick is being turned into a VR game, hopefully sans puppy death |last=McCown |first=Alex |date=August 7, 2015 |accessdate=August 10, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Sofka|first1=Samantha|title=There's a John Wick VR Game on the Way|url=http://nerdist.com/theres-a-john-wick-vr-game-on-the-way/|accessdate=August 8, 2015|publisher=nerdist.com|date=August 7, 2015}}</ref> Additionally, John Wick content – a free ''Character Pack'' and a chargeable ''Weapons Pack'' – was released for the ''[[Payday 2]]'' games on October 20, 2016, as cross-promotion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/545100/|title=Payday 2: John Wick Weapon Pack |publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/330010/|title=Payday 2: John Wick Character Pack |publisher=}}</ref>
The "Reaper" skin in [[Fortnite: Battle Royale]] is a reference to John Wick.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gamesradar.com/still-need-to-unlock-john-wick-heres-when-fortnite-season-3-officially-ends/|title=Still need to unlock John Wick? Here's when Fortnite Season 3 officially ends|last=Sheridan|first=Connor|work=[[GamesRadar+]]|date=April 30, 2018|accessdate=October 3, 2018}}</ref>
== Sequels== {{main|John Wick: Chapter 2|John Wick 3: Parabellum}} A sequel was released on February 10, 2017,<ref name="Johnwicktwo">{{cite web|last1=Cole|first1=Stacy|title=KEANU REEVES' NEW MOVIE MAY BE TOO DISTURBING FOR SOME TO WATCH|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/3017074/keanu-reeves-new-movie-may-be-too-disturbing-for-some-to-watch/|website=Inquisitr|accessdate=April 29, 2016}}</ref> and at the 2016 [[CinemaCon]], Reeves hinted that more sequels had been planned.<ref name="Johnwicktwo"/> Following the release of ''John Wick: Chapter 2'' it was reported that a third film is currently in development with a target release of May 17, 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://collider.com/john-wick-3-filming-chad-stahelski/|title=Exclusive: 'John Wick 3': Chad Stahelski on When They Hope to Start Filming and More|date=May 24, 2017|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/director-chad-stahelski-gives-a-john-wick-3-update/|title=Director Chad Stahelski Gives a John Wick 3 Update|date=June 13, 2017|publisher=}}</ref>
== TV series == In June 2017, it was reported that a prequel series titled ''The Continental'' is in active development. The series will focus on the hotel chain that acts as a neutral ground for assassins, as opposed to the character John Wick.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://screenrant.com/john-wick-prequel-tv-show-continental/|title=John Wick Prequel TV Show Has a Working Title; Won't Center on Wick|date=June 14, 2017|publisher=}}</ref>
==See also== * [[List of films featuring home invasions]] * [[Red (2008 film)|''Red'' (2008 film)]]
